		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/the-concentration" >THE CONCENTRATION</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Courses That Count                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-363146" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	The following courses count for concentration credit in the fields of History &amp; Literature. In most cases, this means that at least 50% of the material in the course relates directly to a distribution requirement or field.
</p>

<h3>
	<a name="field" id="field"></a>
</h3>

<ul class="anchor-list"><li>
		<a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/CTC-ethnic-studies" style="text-decoration:none" title="">Ethnic Studies</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/CTC-america" style="text-decoration:none" title="">American Studies</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/CTC-latin-america" style="text-decoration:none">Latin American Studies</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/CTC-europe" style="text-decoration:none">European Studies</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/CTC-medieval-world" style="text-decoration:none">Medieval World</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/CTC-early-modern" style="text-decoration:none">Early Modern World</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/modern-world" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	If you find a course that you think is well-suited to your own particular course of study, but that does not appear on the list, you may submit a Petition. If you have any questions about courses or concentration credits, please speak with one of the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/people/people/administrative-team" style="text-decoration:none">Assistant Directors of Studies</a>.
</p>

<p>
	All History &amp; Literature concentrators, regardless of field, may count one Arts &amp; Humanities course (including Humanities Pathways, Frameworks, Colloquia: Essential Texts, Essential Questions, and Studio) OR one <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/hl90s" style="text-decoration:none">HL90 Seminar</a> not in the student’s field for concentration credit as an elective.
</p>

<ul><li>
		The <a href="http://artsandhumanities.fas.harvard.edu/book/humanities-10a-and-10b-humanities-colloquium-essential-works-1-2" style="text-decoration:none" target="_blank">Humanities Colloquium </a>courses include:

		<ul><li>
				Humanities 10a. <em>Essential Works in the Western Tradition 1</em>.
			</li>
			<li>
				Humanities 10b. <em>Essential Works in the Western Tradition 2</em>.
			</li>
		</ul></li>
	<li>
		The <a href="http://artsandhumanities.fas.harvard.edu/pages/pathways" style="text-decoration:none" target="_blank">Frameworks in the Humanities</a> courses include:
		<ul><li>
				Humanities 11a. <em>The Art of Looking</em>.
			</li>
			<li>
				Humanities 11b. <em>The Art of Listening</em>.
			</li>
			<li>
				Humanities 11c. <em>The Art of Reading</em>.
			</li>
		</ul></li>
	<li>
		The <a href="http://artsandhumanities.fas.harvard.edu/pages/pathways" style="text-decoration:none" target="_blank">Pathways in the Humanities</a> courses include:
		<ul><li>
				Humanities 12. <em>Essential Works in World Literature</em>.
			</li>
			<li>
				Humanities 52. <em>Human History</em>.
			</li>
			<li>
				Humanities 53. <em>Revolution, Reform and Conservatism in Western Culture</em>.
			</li>
			<li>
				Humanities 54. <em>The Urban Imagination</em>.
			</li>
		</ul></li>
</ul></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

								  <!--sidebar first region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-first sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-88961"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/the-concentration"  class="active-trail active">The Concentration</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-88966"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/sophomore" >Sophomore Tutorial </a></li><li class="collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-88971"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/junior" >Junior Tutorial</a></li><li class="collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-88976"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/senior" >Senior Tutorial</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-88931"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/hl90s" >HL90 Seminars</a></li><li class="leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-88996"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/courses-count"  class="active-trail active active">Courses That Count</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-107996"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/language-requirement" >Language Requirement</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-88846"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/summer-funding" >Summer Funding</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-197981"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/study-abroad" >Study Abroad</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-197986"><a   </div></div></div></div>				  <!--sidebar first region end-->
        
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1442274414" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1442274414"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Previous Courses that Count</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1442274414' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div>
	<a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/ethnic_studies_ctc_2016-2017.docx" style="text-decoration:none">2016-2017 (Ethnic Studies)</a>
</div>

<div>
	<a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/amstud_ctc_2016-2017_new.docx" style="text-decoration:none">2016-2017 (American Studies - new worksheet)</a><br /><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/2016-2017_american_studies_ctc.pdf" style="text-decoration:none">2016-2017 (American Studies - old worksheet)</a>
</div>

<div>
	<a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/latin_american_studies_ctc_-_website.docx" style="text-decoration:none">2016-2017 (Latin American Studies)</a>
</div>

<div>
	<a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/european_studies_ctc_-_website.docx" style="text-decoration:none">2016-2017 (European Studies)</a>
</div>

<div>
	<a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/medieval_world_ctc_-_website.docx" style="text-decoration:none">2016-2017 (Medieval World)</a>
</div>

<div>
	<a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/early_modern_world_ctc_-_website.docx" style="text-decoration:none">2016-2017 (Early Modern World)</a>
</div>

<div>
	<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/european_studies_2015-2016.docx" style="text-decoration:none">2015-2016 (European Studies)</a>
</div>

<div>
	<a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/ctc_america_2015-16-new.pdf" style="text-decoration:none">2015-2016 (America field)</a>
</div>

<div>
	<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/courses_that_count_non-america_15-16_master_list_spring.docx" style="text-decoration:none"><span style="text-decoration:none">2015-2016 (Non-America fields)</span></a><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/ctc_america_2015-16.docx" style="text-decoration:none"> </a><br /><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/august_courses_that_count_non-america_fields_2013-2014_ii.docx" style="text-decoration:none">2015-2016 (Postcolonial)</a><br /><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/ctc_america_2014-15_-_new.pdf" style="text-decoration:none">2014-2015 (America field)</a><br /><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/2014-15_non-america_class_of_2017.docx" style="text-decoration:none">2014-2015 (Non-America fields)</a><br /><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/2013-2014_america_field_electives_and_requirements.docx" style="text-decoration:none">2013-2014 (America field)</a><br /><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/2013-14_non-america_fields.docx" style="text-decoration:none">2013-2014 (Non-America fields)</a>
</div>

<p>
	 
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>

					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1423258810" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1423258810"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1423258810' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/"><img height="66" width="475" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-large" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_large/public/histlit/files/hlbanner1.png?m=1435681341&amp;itok=YHiT_esd" alt="" title="" /></a></p></div></div></div>

				  <!--main menu region beg-->
		  <div id="menu-bar" class="nav region-menu-bar clearfix"><nav id="block-os-primary-menu" class="block block-os no-title menu-wrapper menu-bar-wrapper clearfix"  module="os" delta="primary-menu">  
  
  <ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-primary-menu" id="nice-menu-primary-menu"><li class="menu-18550 menu-path-front  first   odd  "><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" <article id="node-839026" class="node node-person node-teaser article with-person-photo modified-in-os_profiles_process_node clearfix" role="article" target="_top">

      
    
    <div class="field field-name-field-person-photo field-type-imagefield-crop field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser">
    <div class="field-items">
            <div class="field-item even">
      <figure>
        <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/people/mattie-kahn"  target="_top"><img class="image-style-profile-thumbnail" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/profile_thumbnail/public/histlit/files/screen_shot_2016-08-16_at_9.32.34_am.png?m=1502205910&amp;itok=vku4bl-h" width="75" height="75" alt="Mattie Kahn" title="Mattie Kahn" /></a>              </figure>
      </div>
        </div>
</div>    
    <div class="person-teaser-wrapper">  
              <header class="node-header">
                      <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
              <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/people/mattie-kahn" rel="bookmark" target="_top">Mattie Kahn</a>
            </h1>
                  </header>

				  <div class="region region-sidebar-first sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-113271"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/alumni"  class="active-trail active">Alumni Profiles</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-161171"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/recent-graduates"  class="active-trail active active">Recent Graduates</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-161176"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/arts-and-entertainment" >Arts &amp; Entertainment</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-161181"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/media-and-journalism" >Media &amp; Journalism</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-161191"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/government-and-non-profit" >Government &amp; Non-Profit</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-161196"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/medicine" >Medicine</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-161186"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/law" >Law</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-161201"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/business-and-finance" >Business &amp; Finance</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-161206"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/academia-and-education" >Academia &amp; Education</a></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>				  <!--sidebar first region end-->
        
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1469544082" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_follow"  module="boxes" delta="1469544082"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Connect with Hist &amp; Lit alumni!</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1469544082' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div class="item-list"><ul class="follow-me-links-vertical"><li><a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/272244719778081/"  class="follow-icon" style="background-position: -531px 0px" target="_blank">https://www.facebook.com/groups/272244719778081/</a><span class='service-name-span'><a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/272244719778081/"  class="follow-icon-service-name" target="_blank">Facebook</a></span></li><li><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/groups/8523857/profile"  class="follow-icon" style="background-position: -340px 0px" target="_blank">https://www.linkedin.com/groups/8523857/profile</a><span class='service-name-span'><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/groups/8523857/profile"  class="follow-icon-service-name" target="_blank">LinkedIn</a></span></li></ul></div></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1437536011" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1437536011"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Where are they now?</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1437536011' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>Here's a sample of the positions History &amp; Literature alumni have accepted in the past few years.</p>
<ul><li><span>Arthur A. Levine Books, Editorial Assistant</span></li>
<li><span>Bain &amp; Company, Associate Consultant</span></li>
<li><span>Barclays, Global Markets Analyst</span></li>
<li><span>Cambridge University Press, Senior Editorial Assistant</span></li>
<li><span>Clinton Health Access Initiative, Global Markets Associate</span></li>
<li><span>Davis Polk &amp; Wardwell, Associate</span></li>
<li><span>Ford Foundation, Consultant</span></li>
<li><span>Google, User Insights Analyst</span></li>
<li><span>Holliday Fenoglio Fowler LP, Real Estate Analyst</span></li>
<li><span>IBM Design Studio, Analytics Program Manager</span></li>
<li><span>Michigan Children's Law Center, Equal Justice Works Fellow</span></li>
<li><span>Michigan Opera Theatre, Stage Director</span></li>
<li><span>The New Yorker, Integrated Marketing Manager</span></li>
<li><span>OpenTable, Inc., Marketing Editor</span></li>
<li><span>Paul Weiss Rifkind Wharton &amp; Garrison LLP, Associate</span></li>
<li><span>Pulse Films, Director of Digital Partnerships</span></li>
<li><span>Simon &amp; Schuster, Associate Editor</span></li>
<li><span>St Bernard Parish Public Schools, Biology Teacher</span></li>
<li><span>Time Inc., Corporate Strategy Analyst</span></li>
<li><span>US Department of State, Foreign Service Officer</span></li>
</ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>
		<!--footer region beg-->
		<footer id="footer" class="clearfix" role="contentinfo">

					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1423258810" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1423258810"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1423258810' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/"><img height="66" width="475" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-large" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_large/public/histlit/files/hlbanner1.png?m=1435681341&amp;itok=YHiT_esd" alt="" title="" /></a></p></div></div></div>

					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-info" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_info no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_info"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="/ablair" >Harvard University | Ann Blair</a></h1>
    <h2>Carl H. Pforzheimer University Professor</h2>

  </div></div></div></div>					  <div class="region region-header-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-logo" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_logo no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_logo"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_logo' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><a href="/ablair" ><img src="https://projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/ablair/files/blair_ann.jpg?m=1495461757" width="180" height="140" alt="Harvard University | Ann Blair" /></a></div></div></div>

  <ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-primary-menu" id="nice-menu-primary-menu"><li class="menu-26306 menu-path-front  first   odd  "><a href="/ablair" >Home</a></li><li class="menu-23966 menu-path-node-493571   even  "><a href="/ablair/biocv"  title="">Bio/CV</a></li><li class="menu-13018 menu-path-node-231286   odd  "><a href="/ablair/grad-advising"  title="">Grad Advising</a></li><li class="menu-12441 menu-path-node-222511   even  "><a href="/ablair/courses-0"  title="" class="active">Teaching</a></li><li class="menu-12440 menu-path-node-222501   odd  "><a href="/ablair/publications-0" >Publications</a></li><li class="menu-12442 menu-path-node-222526   even   last "><a href="/ablair/websites-0"  title="">Projects/Conferences</a></li></ul>

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="/ablair" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Teaching                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-222511" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	 
</p>

<p>
	<strong>HarvardX Module in "The Book" : <a href="https://www.edx.org/course/book-print-manuscript-western-europe-harvardx-hum1-3x">Print and Manuscript in Europe, Asia, and the Middle East (1450-1650)</a></strong>
</p>

<p>
	<br /><strong>Undergraduate Courses:</strong><br /><strong>History 1318: History of the Book and of Reading </strong>
</p>

<p>
	<a href="https://canvas.harvard.edu/courses/30537" title="">Canvas site (Fall 2017) </a><strong>also taught in Harvard Extension School as </strong><a href="https://canvas.harvard.edu/courses/33462" title="">Hist E-1151</a><br /><a href="http://www.courses.fas.harvard.edu/7410 ">Course isite (Fall 2013)</a><br /><a href="http://www.courses.fas.harvard.edu/%7Ehist1318">Course website </a>(2006-07 academic year)
</p>

<p>
	<strong>Hist 1155: Early Modern Europe</strong>
</p>

<p>
	<br />History 1151: Early modern France, 1500-1715 (formerly History 1450)<br />Includes an optional extra discussion section in French.<br /><a href="http://www.courses.fas.harvard.edu/7575">Course isite (Fall 2011)</a><a href="//canvas.harvard.edu/courses/26372" title="Canvas site"> / Canvas site (unedited)</a>
</p>

<p>
	Culture and Belief 20: Reason and Faith in the West<br />(formerly Historical Studies A-27)<br /><a href="http://www.courses.fas.harvard.edu/8149">Course website </a><br /> 
</p>

<p>
	History 97c: What is the History of History? Sophomore Tutorial<br /><a href="https://canvas.harvard.edu/courses/19190" title="Course website">Course website</a>
</p>

<p>
	<strong>Graduate Seminars:</strong>
</p>

<p>
	<strong>History 3010</strong>: reading group for graduate students preparing field exams in Early Modern intellectual/cultural, Early modern French history, and/or Book History
</p>

<p>
	<a href="https://canvas.harvard.edu/courses/29386" title="">Course website</a><br /><br />History 2321/English 259 (with Leah Price, English Dept): Methods in History of the Book<br /><a href="http://my.harvard.edu/course/colgsas-5169">Course website</a>
</p>

<p>
	History 2121: Cultural History of Early Modern Europe<br /><a href="http://isites.harvard.edu/course/colgsas-60428">Course website</a>
</p>

<p>
	<strong>Graduate Reading Lists:</strong>
</p>

<p>
	<a href="http://projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/ablair/files/blair-3010earlymodernfrancepdf.pdf">Early Modern France and Early Modern European Cultural and Intellectual History</a>
</p>

<p>
	<a href="http://projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/ablair/files/blair-3010histbook2011.pdf">History of the Book</a>
</p>

<p>
	<strong>Past Conference Courses and Seminars:</strong>
</p>

<p>
	History 81a (formerly History 1309): History in Early Modern Europe<br /><a href="http://projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/ablair/files/blair-81a.pdf">syllabus</a><br /><br />History 73b: Introduction to Intellectual History<br /><a href="http://projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/ablair/files/blair-73b.pdf">syllabus</a>
</p>

<p>
	History 90b: Sophomore Tutorial in Early Modern European History<br /><a href="http://isites.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do?keyword=k10003">Course website</a> (2006-2007)<br /><br />History 98: Junior Tutorial on the History of Harvard<br /><a href="http://www.courses.fas.harvard.edu/%7Ehistory/facdata/other/blair_98.pdf">syllabus</a>
</p>

<p>
	History 90d: Sophomore Tutorial in Intellectual History<br /><a href="http://www.courses.fas.harvard.edu/%7Ehistory/facdata/other/blair_90d.pdf">syllabus</a>
</p>

<p>
	History and Literature 97: Sophomore tutorial in Early Modern Europe (full year 2000-01)<br /><a href="http://www.people.fas.harvard.edu/%7Eamblair/HISTLITS.htm">Fall syllabus </a><br /><a href="http://www.people.fas.harvard.edu/%7Eamblair/HLSYLL2.htm">Spring syllabus </a>
</p>

<p>
	The Two Cultures: the Sciences and the Humanities in Historical Perspective (Freshman Seminar, Spring 2000)<br /><a href="http://projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/ablair/files/twocsyll.pdf">syllabus</a>
</p>

<p>
	Educational ideals and practices, from ancient Rome to the Enlightenment (conference course, Spring 1997)<br /><a href="http://www.people.fas.harvard.edu/%7Eamblair/1167WEB.html">Hist 1167 syllabus </a>
</p>

<p>
	Multicultural Switzerland (Freshman Seminar, Fall 1997)<br /><a href="http://www.people.fas.harvard.edu/%7Eamblair/SWISWEB.W51.htm">syllabus </a>
</p>

<p>
	Crisis in European Consciousness, 1680-1715 (conference course, Fall 1997)<br /><a href="http://www.people.fas.harvard.edu/%7Eamblair/1452WEB.htm">Hist 1452 syllabus </a>
</p>

<p>
	Graduate seminar in early modern French intellectual and cultural history<br /><a href="http://www.courses.fas.harvard.edu/%7Ehistory/facdata/other/blair_2320.pdf">Hist 2320 syllabus </a>
</p>
</div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1439306938' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>

</p>

<p>
	<a href="https://calendar.google.com/calendar/selfsched?sstoken=UUxRT3VTdThvZURtfGRlZmF1bHR8YmU3ZTY3ZDRlZGE0MzlhNWZhNjcyYjc1ZTc0M2VjZmQ" target="_blank" title="">DUS Office Hours</a>: Tuesday 10:30am - 12:00pm | Robinson Hall Rm. 100, 35 Quincy Street

			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-info" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_info no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_info"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="/ablair" >Harvard University | Ann Blair</a></h1>
    <h2>Carl H. Pforzheimer University Professor</h2>
    <p>Dept of History, CGIS S437, 1730 Cambridge St, Cambridge MA 02138<br>email: amblair at fas dot harvard dot edu
    </p></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  <div class="region region-header-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-logo" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_logo no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_logo"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_logo' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><a href="/ablair" ><img src="https://projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/ablair/files/blair_ann.jpg?m=1495461757" width="180" height="140" alt="Harvard University | Ann Blair" /></a></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  					  				 </div>

		  <div id="menu-bar" class="nav region-menu-bar clearfix"><nav id="block-os-primary-menu" class="block block-os no-title menu-wrapper menu-bar-wrapper clearfix"  module="os" delta="primary-menu">  
  
  <ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-primary-menu" id="nice-menu-primary-menu"><li class="menu-26306 menu-path-front  first   odd  "><a href="/ablair" >Home</a></li><li class="menu-23966 menu-path-node-493571   even  "><a href="/ablair/biocv"  title="">Bio/CV</a></li><li class="menu-13018 menu-path-node-231286   odd  "><a href="/ablair/grad-advising"  title="" class="active">Grad Advising</a></li><li class="menu-12441 menu-path-node-222511   even  "><a href="/ablair/courses-0"  title="">Teaching</a></li><li class="menu-12440 menu-path-node-222501   odd  "><a href="/ablair/publications-0" >Publications</a></li><li class="menu-12442 menu-path-node-222526   even   last "><a href="/ablair/websites-0"  title="">Projects/Conferences</a></li></ul>

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="/ablair" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Grad Advising                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-231286" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	I offer three graduate exam fields - Reading lists available for download below:
</p>

<p>
	Joint List For:<br /><a href="http://projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/ablair/files/blair-3010earlymodernfrancepdf.pdf">Early Modern European Intellectual and Cultural History<br />Early Modern France 1450 - 1715</a>
</p>

<p>
	<a href="http://projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/ablair/files/blair-3010histbook2011.pdf">History of the Book</a>
</p>

<p>
	<strong>Dissertations completed (others are underway) on which I served</strong>
</p>

<p>
	<strong>as committee chair:</strong>
</p>

<p>
	Amy Houston, “Defending the City, Defending the Faith: The Sieges of the French Civil Wars, 1552-1628" (2010)
</p>

<p>
	Adina Yoffie, "Biblical Literalism and Biblical Scholarship in the Seventeenth Century" (2009)
</p>

<p>
	John Gagné, "French Milan: Citizens, Occupiers and the Italian Wars, 1499-1529" (2008)
</p>

<p>
	<strong>as member of dissertation committee:</strong>
</p>

<p>
	<span><span><span>Paolo Savoia (History of Science), “Men, Faces, and Pain: Gaspare Tagliacozzi and Early Modern Surgery” (2017)</span></span></span>
</p>

<p>
	<span><span><span>Nathan Vedal (EALC), “Scholarly Culture in Sixteenth and Seventeenth Century China” (2017)</span></span></span>
</p>

<p>
	Noam Andrews (History of Science), "Irregular Bodies: Polyhedral Geometry and Material Culture in Early Modern Germany" (2016)
</p>

<p>
	Megan Shields Formato (History of Science), "Writing the Atom: Niels and Margrethe Bohr and the Construction of Quantum Theory" (2016)
</p>

<p>
	Aslihan Gurbuzel (History and Middle Eastern Studies), "Teachers of the Public, Confidants of the Sultan: Preachers and the Rise of the Ottoman Political Public Sphere (1600-1675)" (2016)
</p>

<p>
	Carla Heelan (History), "Origin and Antitype: Medievalism in Nineteenth-Century Germany, 1806-1914" (2016)
</p>

<p>
	Hansun Hsiung (EALC), "Republic of Letters, Empire of Textbooks: Globalizing Western Knowledge, 1790-1895" (2016)
</p>

<p>
	Stuart McManus (History), "The Global Lettered City: Humanism and Empire in Colonial Latin America and the Early Modern World" (2016)
</p>

<p>
	Meredith Quinn (History), "Books and their Readers in Seventeenth-Century Istanbul" (2016)
</p>

<p>
	Sarah Elizabeth Shortall (History), "Soldiers of God in a Secular World: The Politics of Catholic Theology, 1905-1950" (2015)
</p>

<p>
	Kathryn Anne Schwartz (History and Middle Eastern Studies), "Meaningful Mediums: A Material and Intellectual History of Manuscript and Print Production in Nineteenth Century Ottoman Cairo" (2015)
</p>

<p>
	Ren-Yuan LI (East Asian Languages and Civilizations), "Making Texts in Villages<strong>: </strong>Textual Production in Rural China during the Late Imperial Era" (2014)
</p>

<p>
	Michael Tworek (History), “Learning Ennobles: Study Abroad, Renaissance Humanism, and the Transformation of the Polish Nation in the Republic of Letters, 1517-1605” (2014)
</p>

<p>
	Melissa Lo (History of Science), "Between Figure and Line: Visual Transformations of Cartesian Physics, 1620-1690" (2014)
</p>

<p>
	Kristin Williams (East Asian Languages and Civilizations), "Visualizing the Child: Japanese Children’s Literature in the Age of Woodblock Print (ca. 1678-1888)" (2012)
</p>

<p>
	Elias Muhanna (Near Eastern Languages and Civilizations), "Encyclopaedism in the Mamluk Period: The Composition of Shihāb al-Dīn al-Nuwayrī’s (d. 1333)  Nihāyat al-Arab fī Funūn al-Adab" (2012)
</p>

<p>
	Ada Palmer (History), "Reading Lucretius in the Renaissance" (2009)
</p>

<p>
	Jean François Gauvin (History of Science), "Habits of Knowledge: Artisans, Savants and Mechanical Devices in Seventeenth-Century French Natural Philosophy" (2008)
</p>

<p>
	Adam Beaver (History), "A Holy Land for the Catholic Monarchy: Palestine in the Making of Modern Spain, 1469-1598" (2008)
</p>

<p>
	Elizabeth Yale (History of Science), "Manuscript Technologies: Correspondence, Collaboration, and the Construction of Natural Knowledge in Early Modern Britain" (2008)
</p>

<p>
	Michael Legaspi (Near Eastern Languages and Civilizations), "Reviving the Dead Letter: Johann David Michaelis and the Quest for Hebrew Antiquity" (2006)
</p>

<p>
	Matthew Lundin (History), "The Mental World of a Middling Burgher: the Family Archive of Cologne Lawyer Hermann Weinsberg (1518-97)" (2006)
</p>

<p>
	Daniel Stein Kokin (History), "The Hebrew Question in the Italian Renaissance: Linguistic, Cultural and Mystical Perspectives" (2006)
</p>

<p>
	Elizabeth H. Hyde (History), "Cultivated Power: Flowers, Culture and Politics in Early Modern France" (1998)
</p>

<p>
	<strong>as outside reader on dissertations completed elsewhere:</strong>
</p>

<p>
	Frederic Clark (History), "Dividing Time: The Making of Historical Periodization in Early Modern Europe, c.1500-1750," Princeton University, 2014
</p>

<p>
	Suzanne Podhurst (History), “The Scriblerians Uncensored: Libel, Encryption, and the Making of Literary Property in the Eighteenth Century,” Princeton University, 2011
</p>

<p>
	Caroline Sherman (History), "The Genealogy of Knowledge: the Godefroy family, erudition and legal-historical service to the state," Princeton University, 2008
</p>

<p>
	Dominique Brancher (French Literature), "Le voile de Poppée: les ambiguïtés de la pudeur dans le discours médical (1570-1620)," Johns Hopkins University, 2002
</p>

<p>
	<strong>Service as a member of a Jury d'Habilitation de Recherches in France:</strong>
</p>

<p>
	<span>Violaine Giacomotto-Charra on “‘La matière du monde est ceste cire informe’: voies et voix des savoirs de la nature à la Renaissance,” 3 vols. Ecole Normale Supérieure, Paris, 2016</span>
</p>

<p>
	Nicolas Schapira on "Foyers d’écritures, lieux de pouvoir dans la France d’Ancien Régime," 2 vols. Ecole des Hautes Etudes en Sciences Sociales, Paris, 2014
</p>
</div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

								  <!--sidebar first region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-first sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1439306938" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1439306938"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Office Hours Sign-up:</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1439306938' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	<br /><a href="https://calendar.google.com/calendar/selfsched?sstoken=UUdFU1JIOHMtSVROfGRlZmF1bHR8OWVlYTMyODg2YmY2ZjE1YTg0ZTkyYTRhN2U0MTQ4NjA" target="_blank" title="">Regular faculty office hours</a>: Monday 2:00pm - 4:00pm | CGIS S437, 1730 Cambridge Street
</p>

<p>
	<a href="https://calendar.google.com/calendar/selfsched?sstoken=UUxRT3VTdThvZURtfGRlZmF1bHR8YmU3ZTY3ZDRlZGE0MzlhNWZhNjcyYjc1ZTc0M2VjZmQ" target="_blank" title="">DUS Office Hours</a>: Tuesday 10:30am - 12:00pm | Robinson Hall Rm. 100, 35 Quincy Street
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar first region end-->

					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1423258810" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1423258810"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1423258810' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/"><img height="66" width="475" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-large" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_large/public/histlit/files/hlbanner1.png?m=1435681341&amp;itok=YHiT_esd" alt="" title="" /></a></p></div></div></div>

Graduates</a></li><li class="menu-48418 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-arts-and-entertainment   even  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/arts-and-entertainment" >Arts &amp; Entertainment</a></li><li class="menu-48420 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-media-and-journalism   odd  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/media-and-journalism" >Media &amp; Journalism</a></li><li class="menu-48423 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-government-and-non-profit   even  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/government-and-non-profit" >Government &amp; Non-Profit</a></li><li class="menu-48425 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-medicine   odd  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/medicine" >Medicine</a></li><li class="menu-48427   </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<div id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																								
																	<div id="content">
										The URL might be incorrect or have changed.  Please go back to the <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >homepage</a>									</div>
								
							</div><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

  </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<div id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																								
																	<div id="content">
										The URL might be incorrect or have changed.  Please go back to the <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >homepage</a>									</div>
								
							</div><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

  </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<div id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																								
																	<div id="content">
										The URL might be incorrect or have changed.  Please go back to the <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >homepage</a>									</div>
								
							</div><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

					<!--header regions beg-->

					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1423258810" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1423258810"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1423258810' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/"><img height="66" width="475" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-large" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_large/public/histlit/files/hlbanner1.png?m=1435681341&amp;itok=YHiT_esd" alt="" title="" /></a></p></div></div></div>

				  <!--main menu region beg-->
		  <div id="menu-bar" class="nav region-menu-bar clearfix"><nav id="block-os-primary-menu" class="block block-os no-title menu-wrapper menu-bar-wrapper clearfix"  module="os" delta="primary-menu">  
  
  <ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-primary-menu" id="nice-menu-primary-menu"><li class="menu-18550 menu-path-front  first   odd  "><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" 		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">

				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>

								<a name="main-content"></a>
																								
																	<div id="content">
										The URL might be incorrect or have changed.  Please go back to the <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >homepage</a>									</div>

	<div id="page-wrapper">

		
					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1423258810" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1423258810"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1423258810' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/"><img height="66" width="475" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-large" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_large/public/histlit/files/hlbanner1.png?m=1435681341&amp;itok=YHiT_esd" alt="" title="" /></a></p></div></div></div>

      <!--header regions end-->
		
				  <!--main menu region beg-->

					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>

								<a name="main-content"></a>

										The URL might be incorrect or have changed.  Please go back to the <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >homepage</a>									</div>

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												Classes											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<div class="view view-os-classes view-id-os_classes view-display-id-page view-dom-id-e06e94d6b8778b2f3dedf379b66b8259">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first">
    <article id="node-1125516" class="node node-class node-teaser article clearfix" role="article">
  
      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90l-stories-slavery-and-freedom" rel="bookmark">HL90L: Stories of Slavery and Freedom</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Spring</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2018</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	<span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong><a href="mailto:timothy_mccarthy@hks.harvard.edu" style="text-decoration:none">Tim McCarthy</a><br /><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Thursday, 10-12</span>
</p>

<p>
	<img height="137" width="161" style="float: left;" alt="HL90L: Stories of Slavery and Freedom" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/hl90l_tm_slavery.png?m=1501525329&amp;itok=XfELtFEX" title="" /><span style="font-size:small">In the last generation, scholars have revolutionized our understanding of slavery and freedom in the modern Atlantic world. This sea-change has been the result of a major methodological shift: to view this history through the eyes of slaves rather than the eyes of masters. This course will examine the </span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90l-stories-slavery-and-freedom" class="node-readmore">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about HL90L: Stories of Slavery and Freedom</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-2 views-row-even">
    <article id="node-1125511" class="node node-class node-teaser article clearfix" role="article">
  
      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90at-postwar-american-road-narrative-0" rel="bookmark">HL90AT: The Postwar American Road Narrative</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Spring</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2018</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	<span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong><a href="mailto:alworth@fas.harvard.edu" style="text-decoration:none">David J. Alworth</a><br /><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Tuesday, 2-4</span>
</p>

<p>
	<img height="138" width="161" style="float: left;" alt="HL90AT: Postwar American Road Narrative" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/hl90at_da_road.png?m=1501525154&amp;itok=umWI6AOO" title="" /><span style="font-size:small">This course examines a vibrant subgenre of post-World War II American literature. We will read major novels by Kerouac, Nabokov, and Didion as well as less familiar (yet still fascinating) writings by Hunter S. Thompson, Tom Wolfe, Patricia Highsmith, Ralph Ellison, and others. In addition, students </span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90at-postwar-american-road-narrative-0" class="node-readmore">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about HL90AT: The Postwar American Road Narrative</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-3 views-row-odd">
    <article id="node-1125501" class="node node-class node-teaser article clearfix" role="article">
  
      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90bo-sports-and-empire" rel="bookmark">HL90BO: Sports and Empire</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Spring</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2018</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	<span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong><a href="mailto:dloss@fas.harvard.edu" style="text-decoration:none">Daniel Loss</a><br /><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Friday, 1-3</span>
</p>

<p>
	<img height="138" width="161" style="float: left;" alt="HL90BO: Sports and Empire" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/hl90bo_dl_sports.png?m=1501524949&amp;itok=1Im-vGXA" title="" /><span style="font-size:small">How did soccer become a global sport?  What explains the distribution of cricket and rugby around the world?  Are sports a form of cultural imperialism?  This course will explore these questions (and more) as we examine the connection between sports and imperialism.  Themes we will cover </span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90bo-sports-and-empire" class="node-readmore">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about HL90BO: Sports and Empire</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-4 views-row-even">
    <article id="node-1125496" class="node node-class node-teaser article clearfix" role="article">
  
      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90dd-women-war-france-and-colonies" rel="bookmark">HL90DD: Women at War in France and in the Colonies</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Spring</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2018</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	<span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong><a href="mailto:sevcik@fas.harvard.edu" style="text-decoration:none">Stefanie Sevcik</a><br /><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Tuesday, 10-12</span>
</p>

<p>
	<img height="138" width="161" style="float: left;" alt="HL90DD: Women at War" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/hl90dd_ss_france.png?m=1501524672&amp;itok=P3vyBk2H" title="" /><span style="font-size:small">This seminar explores roles women have played in wars for independence across the French-speaking world. As the Italian director Gillo Pontecorvo depicts in his iconic film, The Battle of Algiers (1966), some women fought alongside men carrying bombs in the fight for freedom from the French in </span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90dd-women-war-france-and-colonies" class="node-readmore">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about HL90DD: Women at War in France and in the Colonies</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>

              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90db-museums-america" rel="bookmark">HL90DB: Museums in America</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Spring</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2018</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	<span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong><a href="mailto:gochberg@fas.harvard.edu" style="text-decoration:none">Reed Gochberg</a><br /><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Wednesday, 1-3</span>
</p>

<p>
	<img height="138" width="161" style="float: left;" alt="HL90DB: Museums in America" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/hl90db_rg_museums.png?m=1501524494&amp;itok=7OndOvav" title="" /><span style="font-size:small">In this course, we will consider the literary and cultural history of American museums from the eighteenth century to the present. Throughout the semester, we will discuss how museums have functioned as both centers for research and as public spaces for education and entertainment, and how </span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90db-museums-america" class="node-readmore">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about HL90DB: Museums in America</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90dc-colonialism-madness" rel="bookmark">HL90DC: Colonialism as Madness</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Spring</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2018</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	<span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong><a href="mailto:abattach@fas.harvard.edu" style="text-decoration:none">Anouska Bhattacharyya</a><br /><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Monday, 1-3</span>
</p>

<p>
	<img height="137" width="161" style="float: left;" alt="HL90DC: Colonialism as Madness" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/hl90dc_ab_colonialism.png?m=1501524198&amp;itok=6vbnMR4X" title="" /><span style="font-size:small">Why do we take the history of Euro-American psychiatry as the barometer against which we understand all other histories of madness? Is there a larger narrative of insanity that doesn’t use the Greenwich Meridian as the centre of the world? To give students the tools to answer </span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90dc-colonialism-madness" class="node-readmore">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about HL90DC: Colonialism as Madness</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>

      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90an-god-save-queen-ruling-women-rome-renaissance" rel="bookmark">HL90AN: God Save the Queen! Ruling Women from Rome to the Renaissance</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Spring</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2018</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	<span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong><a href="mailto:gilsdorf@fas.harvard.edu" style="text-decoration:none">Sean Gilsdorf</a><br /><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Monday, 10-12 </span>
</p>

<p>
	<img height="138" width="161" style="float: left;" alt="HL90AN: God Save the Queen" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/hl90an_sg_queens.png?m=1501523750&amp;itok=jOSsdaSD" title="" /><span style="font-size:small">This seminar will explore female rulership in Europe from the late Roman empire to the age of Elizabeth I. Discussion of varied texts and images (most of them primary sources in translation) will reveal the role of queens within their societies, their relationship to broader social and cultural </span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90an-god-save-queen-ruling-women-rome-renaissance" class="node-readmore">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about HL90AN: God Save the Queen! Ruling Women from Rome to the Renaissance</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>

      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90da-rock-and-roll-rap-en-espanol-urban-youth-cultures-america" rel="bookmark">HL90DA: Rock and Roll to Rap en Español: Urban Youth Cultures in América</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Spring</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2018</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	<span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong>Melissa Castillo-Garsow<br /><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Monday, 3-5</span>
</p>

<p>
	<img height="139" width="161" style="float: left;" alt="HL90DA: Urban Youth Cultures" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/hl90da_mcg_youth.png?m=1501521311&amp;itok=aU1v89TC" title="" /><span style="font-size:small">This course explores the history of race relations, civil rights, and youth cultures post WWII through the lens of music history. Although overtime, African American contributions to American Music have become more and more recognized, Latino contributions to popular music in the United States have mostly </span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90da-rock-and-roll-rap-en-espanol-urban-youth-cultures-america" class="node-readmore">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about HL90DA: Rock and Roll to Rap en Español: Urban Youth Cultures in América</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>

      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90cz-middle-eastern-displacements-ottoman-migrants-syrian-refugees" rel="bookmark">HL90CZ: Middle Eastern Displacements: From Ottoman Migrants to Syrian Refugees</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Fall</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2017</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	<span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong><a href="mailto:pece@fas.harvard.edu" style="text-decoration:none">Uğur Z. Peçe</a><br /><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Thursday, 2-4 </span>
</p>

<p>
	<img height="138" width="161" style="float: left;" alt="HL90CZ: Middle Eastern Displacements" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/hl90cz_up_displacements.png?m=1501520480&amp;itok=_hO_S0Gx" title="" /><span style="font-size:small">The current humanitarian disasters in the Middle East and North Africa have brought the plight of refugees in the region to the fore. Taking a long-term historical perspective, this course explores the centrality of migrants and refugees to the formation of the modern Middle East. Drawing on multiple </span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90cz-middle-eastern-displacements-ottoman-migrants-syrian-refugees" class="node-readmore">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about HL90CZ: Middle Eastern Displacements: From Ottoman Migrants to Syrian Refugees</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90cy-watergate-conspiracy-paranoia-and-abuse-power" rel="bookmark">HL90CY: Watergate: Conspiracy, Paranoia, and the Abuse of Power</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Fall</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2017</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	<span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong><a href="mailto:biel@fas.harvard.edu" style="text-decoration:none">Steve Biel</a><br /><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Tuesday, 2-4 </span>
</p>

<p>
	<img height="138" width="161" style="float: left;" alt="HL90CY: Watergate" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/hl90cy_sb_watergate.png?m=1501520288&amp;itok=BqcoG3Wp" title="" /><span style="font-size:small">Russiagate, Emailgate, Benghazigate: these are the latest in a series of scandals and pseudo-scandals bearing the suffix that originates in the name of the Washington hotel where, in the summer of 1972, burglars associated with the Committee to Re-Elect the President broke into the Democratic </span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90cy-watergate-conspiracy-paranoia-and-abuse-power" class="node-readmore">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about HL90CY: Watergate: Conspiracy, Paranoia, and the Abuse of Power</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>

    <article id="node-1125176" class="node node-class node-teaser article clearfix" role="article">
  
      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90cw-great-migrations-black-atlantic-travel-narratives" rel="bookmark">HL90CW: Great Migrations: Black Atlantic Travel Narratives</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Fall</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2017</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	<span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong><a href="mailto:magloire@fas.harvard.edu" style="text-decoration:none">Marina Magloire</a><br /><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Monday, 3-5 </span>
</p>

<p>
	<img height="138" width="161" style="float: left;" alt="HL90CW: Black Atlantic Travel Narratives" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/hl90cw_mm_migrations.png?m=1501513248&amp;itok=MTJWcfFJ" title="" /><span style="font-size:small">The story of the African diaspora begins with, and continues to be shaped by, travel. If, as Angela Davis posits, the ability to travel was one of the most significant ways that “emancipation radically transformed personal lives” of formerly enslaved people, this seminar seeks to consider </span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90cw-great-migrations-black-atlantic-travel-narratives" class="node-readmore">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about HL90CW: Great Migrations: Black Atlantic Travel Narratives</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
  </div>
