    <article id="node-1125171" class="node node-class node-teaser article clearfix" role="article">
  
      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90cx-stop-making-sense-america-1980s" rel="bookmark">HL90CX: Stop Making Sense: America in the 1980s</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Fall</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2017</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	<span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong><a href="mailto:allan@fas.harvard.edu" style="text-decoration:none">Angela S. Allan</a><br /><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Thursday, 1-3 </span>
</p>

<p>
	<img height="137" width="161" style="float: left;" alt="HL90CX: America in the 1980s" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/hl90cx_aa_1980s.png?m=1501513091&amp;itok=B3rUvgrU" title="" /><span style="font-size:small">The 1980s saw the convergence of American politics and economics to strengthen U.S. interests abroad, but the decade was also a moment of enormous social, political, and economic divergence at home. How compatible—or causal—was the end of the cold war with the end of the American cultural </span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90cx-stop-making-sense-america-1980s" class="node-readmore">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about HL90CX: Stop Making Sense: America in the 1980s</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-13 views-row-odd">
    <article id="node-1125161" class="node node-class node-teaser article clearfix" role="article">
  
      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90cv-contemporary-american-literature-and-popular-music" rel="bookmark">HL90CV: Contemporary American Literature and Popular Music</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Fall</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2017</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	<span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong><a href="mailto:awcorey@fas.harvard.edu" style="text-decoration:none">Alex W. Corey</a><br /><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Thursday, 3-5</span>
</p>

<p>
	<img height="128" width="161" style="float: left;" alt="HL90CF: Contemporary American Literature and Popular Music" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/hl90cv_ac_music.png?m=1501512888&amp;itok=NUYITwuV" title="" /><span style="font-size:small">This class examines the relationship between popular music, American literature, and the power structures that organize life in the United States. We will study the ways that music constructs social identities by considering how popular music—in performance, on record, and in written representation—</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90cv-contemporary-american-literature-and-popular-music" class="node-readmore">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about HL90CV: Contemporary American Literature and Popular Music</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-14 views-row-even">
    <article id="node-1125156" class="node node-class node-teaser article clearfix" role="article">
  
      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90cu-fashion-and-slavery" rel="bookmark">HL90CU: Fashion and Slavery</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Fall</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2017</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	<span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong><a href="mailto:" style="text-decoration:none">Jonathan Square</a><br /><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Tuesday, 2-4 </span>
</p>

<p>
	<img height="139" width="161" style="float: left;" alt="HL90CU: Fashion and Slavery" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/hl90cu_js_fashion.png?m=1501512643&amp;itok=FiVKtqKp" title="" /><span style="font-size:small">This course examines the politics of fashion among people of African descent during slavery and the period immediately followed emancipation. Fashion is generative, yet underutilized analytic to explore the experience of the enslaved and their descendants. Geographical breadth is crucial to </span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90cu-fashion-and-slavery" class="node-readmore">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about HL90CU: Fashion and Slavery</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-15 views-row-odd views-row-last">
    <article id="node-1125141" class="node node-class node-teaser article clearfix" role="article">
  
      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90ct-deportation-and-policing-migration-us-history" rel="bookmark">HL90CT: Deportation and the Policing of Migration in U.S. History</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Fall</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2017</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	<span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong><a href="mailto:popeobeda@fas.harvard.edu" style="text-decoration:none">Emily Pope-Obeda</a><br /><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Thursday, 11-1 </span>
</p>

<p>
	<img height="137" width="161" style="float: left;" alt="HL90CT: Deportation and the Policing of Migration" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/hl90ct_epo_deportation.png?m=1501511849&amp;itok=Me68oq2z" title="" /><span style="font-size:small">This course examines the history of deportation in American society, and considers how the policing, exclusion, and expulsion of immigrant populations has shaped the nation. Through historical texts, primary sources, literature, and popular culture, we will cover a wide range of topics including </span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/hl90ct-deportation-and-policing-migration-us-history" class="node-readmore">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about HL90CT: Deportation and the Policing of Migration in U.S. History</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
  </div>
    </div>
  
      <h2 class="element-invisible">Pages</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="pager"><li class="pager-current">1</li><li class="pager-item"><a title="Go to page 2" href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes?page=1">2</a></li><li class="pager-item"><a title="Go to page 3" href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes?page=2">3</a></li><li class="pager-item"><a title="Go to page 4" href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes?page=3">4</a></li><li class="pager-next"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes?page=1">»</a></li><li class="pager-last"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes?page=3">last</a></li></ul></div>  
  
  
  
  
</div>									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1434649112" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1434649112"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Worksheets &amp; Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434649112' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	The following advising tools help guide students in reflecting on their goals and the coherence of their individualized work in the concentration. Concentrators complete these forms in consultation with their tutors.
</p>

<ul><li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-worksheets" style="text-decoration:none">Field Worksheets</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#POC-form" style="text-decoration:none">Plan of Concentration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-declaration-form" style="text-decoration:none">Field Declaration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#modern-world-proposal" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#subfield-form" style="text-decoration:none">Subfield Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#thesis-request" style="text-decoration:none">Senior Thesis Interests Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#petition" style="text-decoration:none">Petition Form</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	Visit the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" style="text-decoration:none">Forms</a> page for a step-by-step guide to these materials and their role in a student's progress through the concentration.
</p>
</div></div></div>

					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1423258810" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1423258810"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1423258810' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/"><img height="66" width="475" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-large" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_large/public/histlit/files/hlbanner1.png?m=1435681341&amp;itok=YHiT_esd" alt="" title="" /></a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  					  <div class="region region-header-third"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-solr-search-box" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_search_solr_search_box no-title"  module="boxes" delta="solr_search_box"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-solr_search_box' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><form class="search-block-form" action="/classes/fall2015/hl90bo-sports-and-empire" method="post" id="search-block-form" accept-charset="UTF-8"><div><div class="container-inline">

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes" >CLASSES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												HL90BO: Sports and Empire											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-453281" class="node node-class article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Spring</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2017</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong>Daniel Loss</span><br /><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Thursday, 1-3</span></p><p><img height="105" width="161" style="float: left;" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/screen_shot_2016-11-29_at_2.29.28_pm.png?m=1480447872&amp;itok=LnDtbKKz" alt="" title="" /><span style="font-size:small">Why do American sports differ from the rest of the world?  How did soccer become a global sport?  What explains the distribution of cricket and rugby around the world?  Are sports a form of cultural imperialism?  This course will explore these questions (and more) as we examine the connection between sports and imperialism.  Themes we will cover include race, class, gender, professionalism, and commercialization.  Readings include rule books, novels, poems, periodicals, memoirs, and films.</span></p></div></div></div><section class="field field-name-field-class-link field-type-link-field field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Link:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://canvas.harvard.edu/courses/4891" >Course website</a></div></div></section>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1434649112" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1434649112"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Worksheets &amp; Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434649112' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	The following advising tools help guide students in reflecting on their goals and the coherence of their individualized work in the concentration. Concentrators complete these forms in consultation with their tutors.
</p>

<ul><li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-worksheets" style="text-decoration:none">Field Worksheets</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#POC-form" style="text-decoration:none">Plan of Concentration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-declaration-form" style="text-decoration:none">Field Declaration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#modern-world-proposal" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#subfield-form" style="text-decoration:none">Subfield Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#thesis-request" style="text-decoration:none">Senior Thesis Interests Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#petition" style="text-decoration:none">Petition Form</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	Visit the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" style="text-decoration:none">Forms</a> page for a step-by-step guide to these materials and their role in a student's progress through the concentration.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>

			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes" >CLASSES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												HL90BQ: Early Modern Encounters											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-453296" class="node node-class article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Fall</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2016</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong>Michael T. Tworek</span><br /><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Monday, 3-5</span><br /><br /><span style="font-size:small"><img height="131" width="162" style="float: left;" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/screen_shot_2016-07-18_at_11.10.21_am.png?m=1468854683&amp;itok=LizQIfiF" alt="" title="" />This course explores the dynamic and diverse movement of people, texts, ideas, and objects across the world during the early modern period (1300-1800). Each week approaches these global exchanges through a case study of a cross-cultural encounter from the Americas and Asia to Africa and Europe. The course will examine the major developments of the period such as the Renaissance, Reformation, Age of Discovery, and the Enlightenment from global and critical perspectives.</span></p></div></div></div><section class="field field-name-field-class-link field-type-link-field field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Link:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://canvas.harvard.edu/courses/5694" >Course website</a></div></div></section>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1434649112" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1434649112"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Worksheets &amp; Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434649112' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	The following advising tools help guide students in reflecting on their goals and the coherence of their individualized work in the concentration. Concentrators complete these forms in consultation with their tutors.
</p>

<ul><li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-worksheets" style="text-decoration:none">Field Worksheets</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#POC-form" style="text-decoration:none">Plan of Concentration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-declaration-form" style="text-decoration:none">Field Declaration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#modern-world-proposal" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#subfield-form" style="text-decoration:none">Subfield Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#thesis-request" style="text-decoration:none">Senior Thesis Interests Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#petition" style="text-decoration:none">Petition Form</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	Visit the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" style="text-decoration:none">Forms</a> page for a step-by-step guide to these materials and their role in a student's progress through the concentration.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>

			<div class="at-panel gpanel panel-display footer clearfix">
												<div class="region region-footer"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1434379136" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1434379136"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434379136' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><span style="font-family:book antiqua,palatino"><span style="font-size:x-large"><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/"><br />Committee on Degrees in History &amp; Literature</a><span style="color:#ffffff"><br /></span></span><span style="font-size:medium; color:#c0c0c0">Barker Center 122 | 12 Quincy Street | Cambridge, MA 02138</span></span><br /><span style="font-family:book antiqua,palatino"><span style="font-size:medium; color:#c0c0c0">617-49</span><span style="color:#c0c0c0"><span style="font-size:medium">5-4</span><span style="font-size:medium">029 | </span><span style="font-size:medium"><a href="mailto:histlit@fas.harvard.edu"><span style="color:#c0c0c0">histlit [at] fas.harvard.edu</span></a></span></span><span style="font-size:medium"></span><span style="font-size:medium; color:#c0c0c0"><br /></span></span></p></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>				<div class="region region-footer-third"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1438363346" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1438363346"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

Journalism</a></li><li class="menu-48423 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-government-and-non-profit   even  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/government-and-non-profit" >Government &amp; Non-Profit</a></li><li class="menu-48425 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-medicine   odd  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/medicine" >Medicine</a></li><li class="menu-48427 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-law   even  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/law" >Law</a></li><li class="menu-48429 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-business-and-finance   odd  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/business-and-finance" >Business &amp; Finance</a></li><li class="menu-48432 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-academia-and-education   even   last "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/academia-and-education" >Academia &amp; Education</a></li></ul></li><li class="menu-42489 menuparent  menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-headlines   odd   last "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/headlines" >Headlines</a><span class="open-submenu"></span><ul><li class="menu-42491 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-faculty-publications  first   odd  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/faculty-publications"  title="">Faculty News</a></li><li class="menu-42493 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-student-work   even  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/student-work"  title="">Student News</a></li><li class="menu-18626 menu-path-node-363446   odd  "><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/lecturer-application"  title="">Lecturer Positions</a></li></ul></li></ul>

  </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes" >CLASSES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												HL90L: Stories of Slavery and Freedom											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-453301" class="node node-class article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Fall</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2016</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong>Timothy P. McCarthy</span><br /><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Tuesday, 10-12</span></p>
<p><span style="font-size:small"><img height="133" width="162" style="float: left;" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/screen_shot_2016-07-18_at_11.19.13_am.png?m=1468855436&amp;itok=y0LyZFWx" alt="" title="" />In the last generation, scholars have revolutionized our understanding of slavery and freedom in the modern Atlantic world. This sea-change has been the result of a major methodological shift: to view this history through the eyes of slaves rather than the eyes of masters. This course will examine the history of the “black Atlantic” through a diverse range of cultural texts—poetry, pamphlets, court cases, petitions, autobiographies, novels, speeches, and sermons—produced by slaves, free blacks, and abolitionists from the Age of Revolution to emancipation.</span></p></div></div></div><section class="field field-name-field-class-link field-type-link-field field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Link:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://canvas.harvard.edu/courses/6566" >Course website</a></div></div></section>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1434649112" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1434649112"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Worksheets &amp; Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434649112' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	The following advising tools help guide students in reflecting on their goals and the coherence of their individualized work in the concentration. Concentrators complete these forms in consultation with their tutors.
</p>

<ul><li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-worksheets" style="text-decoration:none">Field Worksheets</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#POC-form" style="text-decoration:none">Plan of Concentration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-declaration-form" style="text-decoration:none">Field Declaration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#modern-world-proposal" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#subfield-form" style="text-decoration:none">Subfield Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#thesis-request" style="text-decoration:none">Senior Thesis Interests Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#petition" style="text-decoration:none">Petition Form</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	Visit the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" style="text-decoration:none">Forms</a> page for a step-by-step guide to these materials and their role in a student's progress through the concentration.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>

					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1423258810" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1423258810"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

				  <!--main menu region beg-->
		  <div id="menu-bar" class="nav region-menu-bar clearfix"><nav id="block-os-primary-menu" class="block block-os no-title menu-wrapper menu-bar-wrapper clearfix"  module="os" delta="primary-menu">  
  
  <ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-primary-menu" id="nice-menu-primary-menu"><li class="menu-18550 menu-path-front  first   odd  "><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >Home</a></li><li class="menu-18642 menuparent  menu-path-node-363656   even  "><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/learn-more"  title="">Learn More</a><span class="open-submenu"></span><ul><li class="menu-18620 menu-path-node-363416  first   odd  "><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/since-1906"  title="">Since 1906</a></li><li class="menu-21034 menu-path-node-426411   even  "><a 		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes" >CLASSES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												HL90AN: God Save the Queen! Ruling Women from Rome to the Renaissance											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-1125481" class="node node-class article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Spring</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2018</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	<span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong><a href="mailto:gilsdorf@fas.harvard.edu" style="text-decoration:none">Sean Gilsdorf</a><br /><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Monday, 10-12 </span>
</p>

<p>
	<img height="138" width="161" style="float: left;" alt="HL90AN: God Save the Queen" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/hl90an_sg_queens.png?m=1501523750&amp;itok=jOSsdaSD" title="" /><span style="font-size:small">This seminar will explore female rulership in Europe from the late Roman empire to the age of Elizabeth I. Discussion of varied texts and images (most of them primary sources in translation) will reveal the role of queens within their societies, their relationship to broader social and cultural </span><!--break--><span style="font-size:small">institutions such as the Christian Church, and the ways in which queens were celebrated, criticized, and imagined by writers and artists of their time. </span>
</p>
</div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1434649112" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1434649112"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Worksheets &amp; Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434649112' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	The following advising tools help guide students in reflecting on their goals and the coherence of their individualized work in the concentration. Concentrators complete these forms in consultation with their tutors.
</p>

<ul><li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-worksheets" style="text-decoration:none">Field Worksheets</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#POC-form" style="text-decoration:none">Plan of Concentration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-declaration-form" style="text-decoration:none">Field Declaration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#modern-world-proposal" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#subfield-form" style="text-decoration:none">Subfield Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#thesis-request" style="text-decoration:none">Senior Thesis Interests Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#petition" style="text-decoration:none">Petition Form</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	Visit the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" style="text-decoration:none">Forms</a> page for a step-by-step guide to these materials and their role in a student's progress through the concentration.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes" >CLASSES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												HL90AT: The Postwar American Road Narrative											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-761226" class="node node-class article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Fall</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2016</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><strong><span style="font-size:small">Instructor:</span></strong><span style="font-size:small"> </span><span style="font-size:small">David J. Alworth<br /><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Wednesday, 3-5</span></p>
<p><span style="font-size:small"><img height="113" width="162" style="float: left;" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/screen_shot_2016-07-18_at_11.32.08_am.png?m=1468855984&amp;itok=rmVc8br6" alt="" title="" />This course examines a vibrant subgenre of post-World War II American literature. We will read major novels by Kerouac, Nabokov, and Didion as well as less familiar (yet still fascinating) writings by Hunter S. Thompson, Tom Wolfe, Patricia Highsmith, Ralph Ellison, and others. In addition, students can expect to analyze both primary and secondary historical sources, while giving some attention to visual art (e.g. John Chamberlain) and to film (e.g. Bonnie and Clyde).</span></p></div></div></div><section class="field field-name-field-class-link field-type-link-field field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Link:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://canvas.harvard.edu/courses/16584" >Course website</a></div></div></section>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1434649112" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1434649112"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Worksheets &amp; Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434649112' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	The following advising tools help guide students in reflecting on their goals and the coherence of their individualized work in the concentration. Concentrators complete these forms in consultation with their tutors.
</p>

<ul><li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-worksheets" style="text-decoration:none">Field Worksheets</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#POC-form" style="text-decoration:none">Plan of Concentration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-declaration-form" style="text-decoration:none">Field Declaration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#modern-world-proposal" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#subfield-form" style="text-decoration:none">Subfield Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#thesis-request" style="text-decoration:none">Senior Thesis Interests Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#petition" style="text-decoration:none">Petition Form</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	Visit the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" style="text-decoration:none">Forms</a> page for a step-by-step guide to these materials and their role in a student's progress through the concentration.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>
		<!--footer region beg-->
		<footer id="footer" class="clearfix" role="contentinfo">
		<!-- Three column 3x33 Gpanel -->
		
			<div class="at-panel gpanel panel-display footer clearfix">
												<div class="region region-footer"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1434379136" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1434379136"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434379136' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><span style="font-family:book antiqua,palatino"><span style="font-size:x-large"><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/"><br />Committee on Degrees in History &amp; Literature</a><span style="color:#ffffff"><br /></span></span><span style="font-size:medium; color:#c0c0c0">Barker Center 122 | 12 Quincy Street | Cambridge, MA 02138</span></span><br /><span style="font-family:book antiqua,palatino"><span style="font-size:medium; color:#c0c0c0">617-49</span><span style="color:#c0c0c0"><span style="font-size:medium">5-4</span><span style="font-size:medium">029 | </span><span style="font-size:medium"><a href="mailto:histlit@fas.harvard.edu"><span style="color:#c0c0c0">histlit [at] fas.harvard.edu</span></a></span></span><span style="font-size:medium"></span><span style="font-size:medium; color:#c0c0c0"><br /></span></span></p></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>				<div class="region region-footer-third"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1438363346" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1438363346"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

Entertainment</a></li><li class="menu-48420 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-media-and-journalism   odd  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/media-and-journalism" >Media &amp; Journalism</a></li><li class="menu-48423 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-government-and-non-profit   even  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/government-and-non-profit" >Government &amp; Non-Profit</a></li><li class="menu-48425 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-medicine   odd  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/medicine" >Medicine</a></li><li class="menu-48427 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-law   even  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/law" >Law</a></li><li class="menu-48429 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-business-and-finance   odd  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/business-and-finance" >Business &amp; Finance</a></li><li class="menu-48432 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-academia-and-education   even   last "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/academia-and-education" >Academia &amp; Education</a></li></ul></li><li class="menu-42489 menuparent  menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-headlines   odd   last "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/headlines" >Headlines</a><span class="open-submenu"></span><ul><li class="menu-42491 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-faculty-publications  first   odd  "><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/lecturer-application"  title="">Lecturer Positions</a></li></ul></li></ul>

  </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes" >CLASSES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												HL90AT: The Postwar American Road Narrative											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-1125511" class="node node-class article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Spring</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2018</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	<span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong><a href="mailto:alworth@fas.harvard.edu" style="text-decoration:none">David J. Alworth</a><br /><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Tuesday, 2-4</span>
</p>

<p>
	<img height="138" width="161" style="float: left;" alt="HL90AT: Postwar American Road Narrative" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/hl90at_da_road.png?m=1501525154&amp;itok=umWI6AOO" title="" /><span style="font-size:small">This course examines a vibrant subgenre of post-World War II American literature. We will read major novels by Kerouac, Nabokov, and Didion as well as less familiar (yet still fascinating) writings by Hunter S. Thompson, Tom Wolfe, Patricia Highsmith, Ralph Ellison, and others. In addition, students </span><!--break--><span style="font-size:small">can expect to analyze both primary and secondary historical sources, while giving some attention to visual art (e.g. John Chamberlain) and to film (e.g. Bonnie and Clyde). </span>
</p>
</div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1434649112" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1434649112"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Worksheets &amp; Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434649112' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	The following advising tools help guide students in reflecting on their goals and the coherence of their individualized work in the concentration. Concentrators complete these forms in consultation with their tutors.
</p>

<ul><li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-worksheets" style="text-decoration:none">Field Worksheets</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#POC-form" style="text-decoration:none">Plan of Concentration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-declaration-form" style="text-decoration:none">Field Declaration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#modern-world-proposal" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#subfield-form" style="text-decoration:none">Subfield Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#thesis-request" style="text-decoration:none">Senior Thesis Interests Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#petition" style="text-decoration:none">Petition Form</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	Visit the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" style="text-decoration:none">Forms</a> page for a step-by-step guide to these materials and their role in a student's progress through the concentration.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>
		<!--footer region beg-->
		<footer id="footer" class="clearfix" role="contentinfo">

				  <!--main menu region beg-->
		  <div id="menu-bar" class="nav region-menu-bar clearfix"><nav id="block-os-primary-menu" class="block block-os no-title menu-wrapper menu-bar-wrapper clearfix"  module="os" delta="primary-menu">  
  
  <ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-primary-menu" id="nice-menu-primary-menu"><li class="menu-18550 menu-path-front  first   odd  "><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >Home</a></li><li class="menu-18642 menuparent  menu-path-node-363656   even  "><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/learn-more"  title="">Learn More</a><span class="open-submenu"></span><ul><li class="menu-18620 menu-path-node-363416  first   odd  "><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/since-1906"  title="">Since 1906</a></li><li class="menu-21034 menu-path-node-426411   even  "><a 		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes" >CLASSES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												HL90BA: England After Empire											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-761231" class="node node-class article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Fall</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2016</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><strong><span style="font-size:small">Instructor:</span></strong><span style="font-size:small"> </span><span style="font-size:small">Duncan White<br /><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Monday, 1-3<br /></span></p>
<p><span style="font-size:small"><img height="134" width="162" style="float: left;" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/screen_shot_2016-07-18_at_11.33.52_am.png?m=1468856181&amp;itok=1BrZm1SB" alt="" title="" />This course considers the way England was transformed through the demise of its Empire after the Second World War through to the present day. From the birth of the welfare state to the rise of Thatcherism, from post-colonial migration to multicultural Britain, from the Swinging Sixties to punk rock and riots, we will track these radical political, social</span><span style="font-size:small"> </span><span style="font-size:small">and cultural changes through novels, poetry, theater, film, pop music, photography, fashion, food and sport. We will explore the way Britain sought to retain its influence in the world, through its involvement in the Cold War, its relations with the Commonwealth, and its continuing ‘special relationship’ with the United States, even as what being English or British began to change in meaning. As well as reading literary works by Philip Larkin, Jean Rhys, JG Ballard, Salman Rushdie, China Miéville, and Zadie Smith, we will consider the nation’s popular culture, from The Beatles to The Sex Pistols, from James Bond to J.K. Rowling.</span></p></div></div></div><section class="field field-name-field-class-link field-type-link-field field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Link:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://canvas.harvard.edu/courses/16590" >Course website</a></div></div></section>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1434649112" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1434649112"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Worksheets &amp; Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434649112' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	The following advising tools help guide students in reflecting on their goals and the coherence of their individualized work in the concentration. Concentrators complete these forms in consultation with their tutors.
</p>

<ul><li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-worksheets" style="text-decoration:none">Field Worksheets</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#POC-form" style="text-decoration:none">Plan of Concentration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-declaration-form" style="text-decoration:none">Field Declaration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#modern-world-proposal" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#subfield-form" style="text-decoration:none">Subfield Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#thesis-request" style="text-decoration:none">Senior Thesis Interests Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#petition" style="text-decoration:none">Petition Form</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	Visit the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" style="text-decoration:none">Forms</a> page for a step-by-step guide to these materials and their role in a student's progress through the concentration.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>
		<!--footer region beg-->

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes" >CLASSES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												HL90BA: England After Empire											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-1125061" class="node node-class article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Fall</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2017</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	<span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong><a href="mailto:duncanwhite@fas.harvard.edu" style="text-decoration:none">Duncan White</a><br /><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Monday, 11-1 </span>
</p>

<p>
	<span style="font-size:small"><img height="138" width="161" style="float: left;" alt="HL90 BA: England After Empire" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/hl90ba_dw_england.png?m=1501510267&amp;itok=fSsHa7Ya" title="" />This course considers the way England was transformed by the demise of its empire after the Second World War. From the birth of the welfare state to the rise of Thatcherism, from post-colonial migration to multi-culturalism, from Cool Britannia to Brexit, we will track these </span><!--break--><span style="font-size:small">political, social and cultural changes through novels, poetry, theater, film, music, photography, fashion, food and sport. As well as reading literary works by Philip Larkin, Jean Rhys, Salman Rushdie, and Zadie Smith, we will consider the nation’s popular culture, including The Beatles, James Bond and J.K. Rowling. </span>
</p>
</div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1434649112" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1434649112"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Worksheets &amp; Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434649112' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	The following advising tools help guide students in reflecting on their goals and the coherence of their individualized work in the concentration. Concentrators complete these forms in consultation with their tutors.
</p>

<ul><li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-worksheets" style="text-decoration:none">Field Worksheets</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#POC-form" style="text-decoration:none">Plan of Concentration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-declaration-form" style="text-decoration:none">Field Declaration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#modern-world-proposal" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#subfield-form" style="text-decoration:none">Subfield Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#thesis-request" style="text-decoration:none">Senior Thesis Interests Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#petition" style="text-decoration:none">Petition Form</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	Visit the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" style="text-decoration:none">Forms</a> page for a step-by-step guide to these materials and their role in a student's progress through the concentration.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>
		<!--footer region beg-->
		<footer id="footer" class="clearfix" role="contentinfo">
		<!-- Three column 3x33 Gpanel -->
		
			<div class="at-panel gpanel panel-display footer clearfix">
												<div class="region region-footer"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1434379136" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1434379136"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434379136' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><span style="font-family:book antiqua,palatino"><span style="font-size:x-large"><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/"><br />Committee on Degrees in History &amp; Literature</a><span style="color:#ffffff"><br /></span></span><span style="font-size:medium; color:#c0c0c0">Barker Center 122 | 12 Quincy Street | Cambridge, MA 02138</span></span><br /><span style="font-family:book antiqua,palatino"><span style="font-size:medium; color:#c0c0c0">617-49</span><span style="color:#c0c0c0"><span style="font-size:medium">5-4</span><span style="font-size:medium">029 | </span><span style="font-size:medium"><a href="mailto:histlit@fas.harvard.edu"><span style="color:#c0c0c0">histlit [at] fas.harvard.edu</span></a></span></span><span style="font-size:medium"></span><span style="font-size:medium; color:#c0c0c0"><br /></span></span></p></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>				<div class="region region-footer-third"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1438363346" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1438363346"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

Non-Profit</a></li><li class="menu-48425 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-medicine   odd  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/medicine" >Medicine</a></li><li class="menu-48427 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-law   even  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/law" >Law</a></li><li class="menu-48429 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-business-and-finance   odd  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/business-and-finance" >Business &amp; Finance</a></li><li class="menu-48432 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-academia-and-education   even   last "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/academia-and-education" >Academia &amp; Education</a></li></ul></li><li class="menu-42489 menuparent  menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-headlines   odd   last "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/headlines" >Headlines</a><span class="open-submenu"></span><ul><li class="menu-42491 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-faculty-publications  first   odd  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/faculty-publications"  title="">Faculty News</a></li><li class="menu-42493 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-student-work   even  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/student-work"  title="">Student News</a></li><li class="menu-18626 menu-path-node-363446   odd  "><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/lecturer-application"  title="">Lecturer Positions</a></li></ul></li></ul>

  </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes" >CLASSES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												HL90BC: We the Readers: Reading Communities in Early America											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-453761" class="node node-class article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Fall</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2016</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p style="text-align:left"><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong>Jennifer Brady</span><br /><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Wednesday, 1-3<br /></span></p>
<p><span style="font-size:small"><img height="133" width="162" style="float: left;" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/screen_shot_2016-07-18_at_11.11.42_am.png?m=1468854794&amp;itok=FE4dl-VW" alt="" title="" />This seminar asks who was reading, what was read, and how Reading was practiced, imagined, and used in early America. Focusing on moments when reading’s potential to create or divide Communities was under question, “We the Readers” considers how the mundane acts of reading printed sermons, daily newspapers, bestselling novels, political pamphlets, and urban signs were understood to have varying consequences for women, Native Americans, subjects, citizens, and slaves—and through them, a nation.</span></p></div></div></div><section class="field field-name-field-class-link field-type-link-field field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Link:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://canvas.harvard.edu/courses/10107" >Course website</a></div></div></section>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1434649112" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1434649112"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Worksheets &amp; Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434649112' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	The following advising tools help guide students in reflecting on their goals and the coherence of their individualized work in the concentration. Concentrators complete these forms in consultation with their tutors.
</p>

<ul><li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-worksheets" style="text-decoration:none">Field Worksheets</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#POC-form" style="text-decoration:none">Plan of Concentration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-declaration-form" style="text-decoration:none">Field Declaration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#modern-world-proposal" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#subfield-form" style="text-decoration:none">Subfield Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#thesis-request" style="text-decoration:none">Senior Thesis Interests Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#petition" style="text-decoration:none">Petition Form</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	Visit the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" style="text-decoration:none">Forms</a> page for a step-by-step guide to these materials and their role in a student's progress through the concentration.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>
		<!--footer region beg-->
		<footer id="footer" class="clearfix" role="contentinfo">

		  <div id="menu-bar" class="nav region-menu-bar clearfix"><nav id="block-os-primary-menu" class="block block-os no-title menu-wrapper menu-bar-wrapper clearfix"  module="os" delta="primary-menu">  
  
  <ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-primary-menu" id="nice-menu-primary-menu"><li class="menu-18550 menu-path-front  first   odd  "><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" 		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes" >CLASSES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												HL90BG: Colonization, Globalization, and Cultures of Asian Diaspora(s)											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-761281" class="node node-class article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Spring</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2017</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong>Genevieve Clutario</span><br /><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Tuesday, 2-4</span></p><p><img height="128" width="161" style="float: left;" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/screen_shot_2016-11-29_at_2.25.36_pm.png?m=1480447609&amp;itok=ouzDjLvt" alt="" title="" /><span style="font-size:small">This course takes a cultural approach to historical developments of Asian diaspora, colonialism, and globalization through the lenses of appearance and performance. We examine performative and cultural arenas including literary fiction, spectacles, and visual texts to examine efforts to strategically use discourses of race, gender, class, ethnicity, sexuality, and (trans)nationalism to structure and maintain colonial forces. This class pushes us to consider how marginalized individuals and communities also used the same arenas to resist and critique colonial subjugation.</span></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1434649112" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1434649112"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Worksheets &amp; Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434649112' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	The following advising tools help guide students in reflecting on their goals and the coherence of their individualized work in the concentration. Concentrators complete these forms in consultation with their tutors.
</p>

<ul><li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-worksheets" style="text-decoration:none">Field Worksheets</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#POC-form" style="text-decoration:none">Plan of Concentration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-declaration-form" style="text-decoration:none">Field Declaration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#modern-world-proposal" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#subfield-form" style="text-decoration:none">Subfield Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#thesis-request" style="text-decoration:none">Senior Thesis Interests Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#petition" style="text-decoration:none">Petition Form</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	Visit the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" style="text-decoration:none">Forms</a> page for a step-by-step guide to these materials and their role in a student's progress through the concentration.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>
