		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes" >CLASSES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												HL90BK: American Economic Fictions											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-450401" class="node node-class article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Fall</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2016</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="page">
<div class="section">
<div class="layoutArea">
<div class="column">
<p><strong><span style="font-size:small; font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Instructor:</span></strong><span style="font-size:small; font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"> </span><span style="font-size:small; font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Angela S. Allan<br /><strong>Meeting t</strong></span><span style="font-size:small; font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><strong>ime: </strong>Thursday, 1-3</span></p>
<p><span style="font-size:small; font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><img height="123" width="162" style="float: left;" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/screen_shot_2016-07-18_at_11.06.10_am.png?m=1468854530&amp;itok=pK1XMu2n" alt="" title="" />This </span><span style="font-size:small; font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">course considers the culture of American capitalism through an examination of a broad range of literary and historical texts. As we explore the shifts in thinking about class, labor, busines</span><span style="font-size:small; font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">s, and money from the early days of the republic through the present day, we will ask how a wide variety of cultural producers engage with and critique economic thought.</span></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div><section class="field field-name-field-class-link field-type-link-field field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Link:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://canvas.harvard.edu/courses/16516" >Course website</a></div></div></section>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1434649112" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1434649112"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Worksheets &amp; Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434649112' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	The following advising tools help guide students in reflecting on their goals and the coherence of their individualized work in the concentration. Concentrators complete these forms in consultation with their tutors.
</p>

<ul><li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-worksheets" style="text-decoration:none">Field Worksheets</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#POC-form" style="text-decoration:none">Plan of Concentration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-declaration-form" style="text-decoration:none">Field Declaration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#modern-world-proposal" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#subfield-form" style="text-decoration:none">Subfield Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#thesis-request" style="text-decoration:none">Senior Thesis Interests Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#petition" style="text-decoration:none">Petition Form</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	Visit the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" style="text-decoration:none">Forms</a> page for a step-by-step guide to these materials and their role in a student's progress through the concentration.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>

  </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes" >CLASSES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												HL90BO: Sports and Empire											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-1125501" class="node node-class article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Spring</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2018</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	<span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong><a href="mailto:dloss@fas.harvard.edu" style="text-decoration:none">Daniel Loss</a><br /><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Friday, 1-3</span>
</p>

<p>
	<img height="138" width="161" style="float: left;" alt="HL90BO: Sports and Empire" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/hl90bo_dl_sports.png?m=1501524949&amp;itok=1Im-vGXA" title="" /><span style="font-size:small">How did soccer become a global sport?  What explains the distribution of cricket and rugby around the world?  Are sports a form of cultural imperialism?  This course will explore these questions (and more) as we examine the connection between sports and imperialism.  Themes we will cover </span><!--break--><span style="font-size:small">include race, class, gender, professionalism, and commercialization.  Course materials include rule books, novels, poems, periodicals, memoirs, and films. </span>
</p>
</div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1434649112" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1434649112"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Worksheets &amp; Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434649112' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	The following advising tools help guide students in reflecting on their goals and the coherence of their individualized work in the concentration. Concentrators complete these forms in consultation with their tutors.
</p>

<ul><li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-worksheets" style="text-decoration:none">Field Worksheets</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#POC-form" style="text-decoration:none">Plan of Concentration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-declaration-form" style="text-decoration:none">Field Declaration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#modern-world-proposal" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#subfield-form" style="text-decoration:none">Subfield Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#thesis-request" style="text-decoration:none">Senior Thesis Interests Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#petition" style="text-decoration:none">Petition Form</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	Visit the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" style="text-decoration:none">Forms</a> page for a step-by-step guide to these materials and their role in a student's progress through the concentration.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>

  </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes" >CLASSES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												HL90BR: Cultures of Commodity Production Across the Americas											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-453766" class="node node-class article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Spring</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2017</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong>Frances P. Sullivan</span><br /><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Monday, 1-3</span></p><p align="center" style="text-align:left"><img height="127" width="161" style="float: left;" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/screen_shot_2016-11-29_at_2.32.31_pm.png?m=1480448016&amp;itok=4nfmy5OU" alt="" title="" /><span style="font-size:small">This seminar explores the history of Latin American and Caribbean commodity production, including sugar, bananas, coffee, rubber, electronics, and cocaine. Drawing on historical texts, poetry, fiction, and film, we will study the diverse communities created by the women and men laboring in the region’s major export industries. This course invites students to learn about the rich cultural and social histories linking individuals to wider processes of commodity circulation and global capitalism.</span></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1434649112" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1434649112"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Worksheets &amp; Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434649112' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	The following advising tools help guide students in reflecting on their goals and the coherence of their individualized work in the concentration. Concentrators complete these forms in consultation with their tutors.
</p>

<ul><li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-worksheets" style="text-decoration:none">Field Worksheets</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#POC-form" style="text-decoration:none">Plan of Concentration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-declaration-form" style="text-decoration:none">Field Declaration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#modern-world-proposal" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#subfield-form" style="text-decoration:none">Subfield Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#thesis-request" style="text-decoration:none">Senior Thesis Interests Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#petition" style="text-decoration:none">Petition Form</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	Visit the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" style="text-decoration:none">Forms</a> page for a step-by-step guide to these materials and their role in a student's progress through the concentration.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>

    <a href="#main-content" class="element-invisible element-focusable" tabindex="1">Skip to main content</a>
  </div>
    <div id="page_wrap" class="page_wrap">

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes" >CLASSES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												HL90BX: WWI in Fiction, Film, Poetry, and Memoir											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-493276" class="node node-class article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Fall</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2016</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong>Steve Biel and Lauren Kaminsky<strong><br />Meeting time: </strong>Thursday, 3-5<br /></span></p>
<p><span style="font-size:small"><img height="113" width="162" style="float: left;" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/screen_shot_2016-07-18_at_11.14.17_am.png?m=1468854933&amp;itok=LeuQ9eFQ" alt="" title="" />On the centenary of the First World War,  this seminar will explore a wide range of representations of the conflict that began in the Balkans but swept through Europe to the Middle East and Russia, to the Atlantic, Pacific, and Indian Oceans, to the Mediterranean, Baltic, and Black Seas, and drew in soldiers and civilians from Africa, Asia, and the Americas. By looking closely at materials across genres and cultural forms, we will examine the contradictions and contingencies of the war that set the stage for a century of political, social, and cultural history.</span></p></div></div></div><section class="field field-name-field-class-link field-type-link-field field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Link:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://canvas.harvard.edu/courses/5755" >Course website</a></div></div></section>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1434649112" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1434649112"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Worksheets &amp; Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434649112' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	The following advising tools help guide students in reflecting on their goals and the coherence of their individualized work in the concentration. Concentrators complete these forms in consultation with their tutors.
</p>

<ul><li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-worksheets" style="text-decoration:none">Field Worksheets</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#POC-form" style="text-decoration:none">Plan of Concentration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-declaration-form" style="text-decoration:none">Field Declaration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#modern-world-proposal" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#subfield-form" style="text-decoration:none">Subfield Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#thesis-request" style="text-decoration:none">Senior Thesis Interests Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#petition" style="text-decoration:none">Petition Form</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	Visit the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" style="text-decoration:none">Forms</a> page for a step-by-step guide to these materials and their role in a student's progress through the concentration.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>

				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes" >CLASSES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												HL90BY: Cold War Cinema											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-493286" class="node node-class article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Fall</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2016</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong>Paul K. Adler</span><br /><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Wednesday, 3-5</span></p>
<p><span style="font-size:small"><em><img height="124" width="162" style="float: left;" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/screen_shot_2016-07-18_at_11.15.50_am.png?m=1468855024&amp;itok=DaLDXAMJ" alt="" title="" /></em></span><span style="font-size:small">This course offers a history of the United States and the Cold War through films made during the conflict. We will examine the Cold War through two themes which drove much U.S. Cold War policymaking, from McCarthyism to Vietnam. The first theme is subversion: the fear that the United States (or our allies) would be quietly infiltrated by Communists and other radicals who would seize power “from the inside.” The second theme is insurgency: the fear of a violent uprising by marginalized communities that would weaken or overthrow free world institutions.</span></p></div></div></div><section class="field field-name-field-class-link field-type-link-field field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Link:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://canvas.harvard.edu/courses/7052" >Course website</a></div></div></section>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1434649112" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1434649112"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Worksheets &amp; Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434649112' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	The following advising tools help guide students in reflecting on their goals and the coherence of their individualized work in the concentration. Concentrators complete these forms in consultation with their tutors.
</p>

<ul><li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-worksheets" style="text-decoration:none">Field Worksheets</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#POC-form" style="text-decoration:none">Plan of Concentration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-declaration-form" style="text-decoration:none">Field Declaration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#modern-world-proposal" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#subfield-form" style="text-decoration:none">Subfield Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#thesis-request" style="text-decoration:none">Senior Thesis Interests Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#petition" style="text-decoration:none">Petition Form</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	Visit the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" style="text-decoration:none">Forms</a> page for a step-by-step guide to these materials and their role in a student's progress through the concentration.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes" >CLASSES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												HL90BZ: Harvard, Meritocracy, and the Making of Elites											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-493306" class="node node-class article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Fall</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2016</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong>Ryan Acton</span><br /><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Wednesday, 1-3</span></p>
<p><span style="font-size:x-small"><img height="134" width="162" style="float: left;" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/screen_shot_2016-07-18_at_11.17.04_am.png?m=1468855117&amp;itok=tKoV_ds5" alt="" title="" /><span style="font-size:small">The belief that resources such as education and rewards such as high pay should go to the meritorious is so deeply ingrained in our culture that it provides much of the basic logic and vocabulary for making sense of inequality and hierarchy in everyday life. This seminar historicizes meritocracy as an ideal and practice by focusing on Harvard University since the Civil War. Throughout this period, Harvard has seen its role as training a meritorious elite to lead society. We will study the historical politics of this elitism in the context of class, race, gender, capitalism, and mass democracy.</span></span></p></div></div></div><section class="field field-name-field-class-link field-type-link-field field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Link:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://canvas.harvard.edu/courses/5884" >Course website</a></div></div></section>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1434649112" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1434649112"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Worksheets &amp; Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434649112' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	The following advising tools help guide students in reflecting on their goals and the coherence of their individualized work in the concentration. Concentrators complete these forms in consultation with their tutors.
</p>

<ul><li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-worksheets" style="text-decoration:none">Field Worksheets</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#POC-form" style="text-decoration:none">Plan of Concentration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-declaration-form" style="text-decoration:none">Field Declaration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#modern-world-proposal" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#subfield-form" style="text-decoration:none">Subfield Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#thesis-request" style="text-decoration:none">Senior Thesis Interests Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#petition" style="text-decoration:none">Petition Form</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	Visit the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" style="text-decoration:none">Forms</a> page for a step-by-step guide to these materials and their role in a student's progress through the concentration.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes" >CLASSES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												HL90CB: Environmental Change in American Literature and History											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-1125066" class="node node-class article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Fall</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2017</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	<span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong><a href="mailto:feeley@fas.harvard.edu" style="text-decoration:none">Lynne M. Feeley</a><br /><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Wednesday, 10-12 </span>
</p>

<p>
	<span style="font-size:small"><img height="138" width="161" style="float: left;" alt="HL90CB: Environmental Change" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/hl90cb_lf_environmental.png?m=1501510606&amp;itok=v7MWhvbQ" title="" />This course examines American environmental literature from the period of colonization through the era of climate change.  Our focus will be on how people from an array of different backgrounds experienced and inscribed North American environments.  </span><!--break--><span style="font-size:small">We will pay particular attention to issues of race, class, and gender in the history and literature of environmental change. </span>
</p>
</div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1434649112" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1434649112"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Worksheets &amp; Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434649112' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	The following advising tools help guide students in reflecting on their goals and the coherence of their individualized work in the concentration. Concentrators complete these forms in consultation with their tutors.
</p>

<ul><li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-worksheets" style="text-decoration:none">Field Worksheets</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#POC-form" style="text-decoration:none">Plan of Concentration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-declaration-form" style="text-decoration:none">Field Declaration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#modern-world-proposal" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#subfield-form" style="text-decoration:none">Subfield Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#thesis-request" style="text-decoration:none">Senior Thesis Interests Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#petition" style="text-decoration:none">Petition Form</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	Visit the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" style="text-decoration:none">Forms</a> page for a step-by-step guide to these materials and their role in a student's progress through the concentration.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes" >CLASSES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												HL90CC: Boundaries, Borders, Bodies											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-493301" class="node node-class article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Fall</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2016</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong>Maryam Monalisa Gharavi</span><br /><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Tuesday, 10-12</span><br /><br /><span style="font-size:small"><img height="135" width="162" style="float: left;" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/screen_shot_2016-07-18_at_3.43.53_pm.png?m=1468871135&amp;itok=QXbz6qax" alt="" title="" />This hybrid course combines a studio arts practicum with a history &amp; theory seminar. <strong>SEMINAR COMPONENT: </strong>We focus on border geographies, urban boundaries, and demarcations that throw light on basic understandings of inclusion and exclusion, selfhood, freedom, property, and how "us" and "them" are defined materially and conceptually along the course of time. The course traces along zones of passage that limit, regulate, and control mobility (including frontiers, enclosures, walls, barbed wire, among others) and theories of the distribution of the sensible (including security, circulation, flow, among others). We will traverse multiple fields of analysis where these terms have been illuminated, including science/geography (space, place, land), social science (zone, territory, state) and the arts/humanities (identity, subjectivity, memory). <strong>ARTS COMPONENT: </strong>Students will engage with works of art relating to the seminar’s themes and produce works of art of their own. No previous experience in the arts is expected or assumed, and a process-based approach to making work in any medium is encouraged. Students are provided with a small materials budget, shared access to studio space, arts-making workshops, and open studio sessions.<br /></span></p></div></div></div><section class="field field-name-field-class-link field-type-link-field field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Link:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://canvas.harvard.edu/courses/16591" >Course website</a></div></div></section>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1434649112" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1434649112"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Worksheets &amp; Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434649112' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	The following advising tools help guide students in reflecting on their goals and the coherence of their individualized work in the concentration. Concentrators complete these forms in consultation with their tutors.
</p>

<ul><li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-worksheets" style="text-decoration:none">Field Worksheets</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#POC-form" style="text-decoration:none">Plan of Concentration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-declaration-form" style="text-decoration:none">Field Declaration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#modern-world-proposal" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#subfield-form" style="text-decoration:none">Subfield Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#thesis-request" style="text-decoration:none">Senior Thesis Interests Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#petition" style="text-decoration:none">Petition Form</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	Visit the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" style="text-decoration:none">Forms</a> page for a step-by-step guide to these materials and their role in a student's progress through the concentration.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>
		<!--footer region beg-->
		<footer id="footer" class="clearfix" role="contentinfo">

					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1423258810" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1423258810"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

class="menu-162514 menu-path-https--histlitfasharvardedu-study-abroad   even  "><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/study-abroad" >Study Abroad</a></li><li class="menu-162516   </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes" >CLASSES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												HL90CE: The Civil War in the American Imagination											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-761291" class="node node-class article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Spring</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2017</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong>Erin Pearson</span><br /><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Wednesday, 10-12</span></p><p><img height="122" width="161" style="float: left;" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/capture_6.png?m=1480448392&amp;itok=uT3ENnbK" alt="" title="" /><span style="font-size:small">This course asks how Americans have made sense of the Civil War.  It begins by investigating texts that reflect the escalating sectional tensions in the decades preceding the war, particularly in regard to slavery.  Moving from secession to Lincoln’s assassination, the heart of the course considers how people grappled with the war in a variety of formats, from speeches and newspaper editorials to diaries, poetry, and photography.  We conclude by examining how the war has continued to shape American culture, in fiction and film as well as in current practices of Civil War reenactment and debates over the Confederate flag.</span></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1434649112" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1434649112"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Worksheets &amp; Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434649112' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	The following advising tools help guide students in reflecting on their goals and the coherence of their individualized work in the concentration. Concentrators complete these forms in consultation with their tutors.
</p>

<ul><li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-worksheets" style="text-decoration:none">Field Worksheets</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#POC-form" style="text-decoration:none">Plan of Concentration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-declaration-form" style="text-decoration:none">Field Declaration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#modern-world-proposal" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#subfield-form" style="text-decoration:none">Subfield Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#thesis-request" style="text-decoration:none">Senior Thesis Interests Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#petition" style="text-decoration:none">Petition Form</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	Visit the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" style="text-decoration:none">Forms</a> page for a step-by-step guide to these materials and their role in a student's progress through the concentration.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>

					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1423258810" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1423258810"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1423258810' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/"><img height="66" width="475" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-large" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_large/public/histlit/files/hlbanner1.png?m=1435681341&amp;itok=YHiT_esd" alt="" title="" /></a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  					  <div class="region region-header-third"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-solr-search-box" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_search_solr_search_box no-title"  module="boxes" delta="solr_search_box"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes" >CLASSES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												HL90CF: The American Prison &amp; the Literature of Punishment											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-761296" class="node node-class article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Spring</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2017</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong>Thomas Dichter</span><br /><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Wednesday, 1-3</span></p><p><img height="123" width="161" style="float: left;" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/capture_5.png?m=1480448638&amp;itok=xNoxQrId" alt="" title="" /><span style="font-size:small">The United States currently keeps more people behind bars than any other country. While the US’s emergence as the leader in incarceration rates is relatively recent, the prison has loomed large in American public life for 200 years. In this class, we will approach the prison not as a marginal phenomenon, but as an institution central to American culture. Readings include works of literature by and about prisoners as well as reformers’ pamphlets, sociological studies, government reports, and inmate manifestos. We will trace debates about freedom and captivity from the birth of the penitentiary through the era of mass incarceration.</span></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1434649112" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1434649112"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Worksheets &amp; Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434649112' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	The following advising tools help guide students in reflecting on their goals and the coherence of their individualized work in the concentration. Concentrators complete these forms in consultation with their tutors.
</p>

<ul><li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-worksheets" style="text-decoration:none">Field Worksheets</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#POC-form" style="text-decoration:none">Plan of Concentration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-declaration-form" style="text-decoration:none">Field Declaration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#modern-world-proposal" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#subfield-form" style="text-decoration:none">Subfield Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#thesis-request" style="text-decoration:none">Senior Thesis Interests Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#petition" style="text-decoration:none">Petition Form</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	Visit the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" style="text-decoration:none">Forms</a> page for a step-by-step guide to these materials and their role in a student's progress through the concentration.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes" >CLASSES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												HL90CG: Remembering the American Revolution											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-761236" class="node node-class article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Fall</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2016</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong>Caitlin Hopkins</span><br /><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Thursday, 1-3</span></p>
<p><span style="font-size:small"><img height="134" width="162" style="float: left;" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/screen_shot_2016-07-18_at_11.39.24_am.png?m=1468856514&amp;itok=ZUJSyW95" alt="" title="" />The American Revolution ended two centuries ago, but Americans have never stopped talking (or arguing, or singing, or painting) about it. What has captivated so many for so long? Why does the story of the Revolution keep changing? Why is everyone so excited about Hamilton? This interdisciplinary seminar explores public commemoration of the Revolution through various media, from the Bunker Hill Monument and “Paul Revere’s Ride” to Bicentennial protest literature and the lyrics of Lin-Manuel Miranda. Assignments include a scavenger hunt for local memorials and a field trip to the Freedom Trail.</span></p></div></div></div><section class="field field-name-field-class-link field-type-link-field field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Link:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://canvas.harvard.edu/courses/12814" >Course website</a></div></div></section>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1434649112" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1434649112"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Worksheets &amp; Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434649112' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	The following advising tools help guide students in reflecting on their goals and the coherence of their individualized work in the concentration. Concentrators complete these forms in consultation with their tutors.
</p>

<ul><li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-worksheets" style="text-decoration:none">Field Worksheets</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#POC-form" style="text-decoration:none">Plan of Concentration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-declaration-form" style="text-decoration:none">Field Declaration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#modern-world-proposal" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#subfield-form" style="text-decoration:none">Subfield Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#thesis-request" style="text-decoration:none">Senior Thesis Interests Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#petition" style="text-decoration:none">Petition Form</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	Visit the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" style="text-decoration:none">Forms</a> page for a step-by-step guide to these materials and their role in a student's progress through the concentration.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>
		<!--footer region beg-->

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434379136' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><span style="font-family:book antiqua,palatino"><span style="font-size:x-large"><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/"><br />Committee on Degrees in History &amp; Literature</a><span style="color:#ffffff"><br /></span></span><span style="font-size:medium; color:#c0c0c0">Barker Center 122 | 12 Quincy Street | Cambridge, MA 02138</span></span><br /><span style="font-family:book antiqua,palatino"><span style="font-size:medium; color:#c0c0c0">617-49</span><span style="color:#c0c0c0"><span style="font-size:medium">5-4</span><span style="font-size:medium">029 | </span><span style="font-size:medium"><a href="mailto:histlit@fas.harvard.edu"><span style="color:#c0c0c0">histlit [at] fas.harvard.edu</span></a></span></span><span style="font-size:medium"></span><span style="font-size:medium; color:#c0c0c0"><br /></span></span></p></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>				<div class="region region-footer-third"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1438363346" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1438363346"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

Non-Profit</a></li><li class="menu-48425 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-medicine   odd  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/medicine" >Medicine</a></li><li class="menu-48427 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-law   even  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/law" >Law</a></li><li class="menu-48429 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-business-and-finance   odd  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/business-and-finance" >Business &amp; Finance</a></li><li class="menu-48432 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-academia-and-education   even   last "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/academia-and-education" >Academia &amp; Education</a></li></ul></li><li class="menu-42489 menuparent  menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-headlines   odd   last "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/headlines" >Headlines</a><span class="open-submenu"></span><ul><li class="menu-42491 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-faculty-publications  first   odd  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/faculty-publications"  title="">Faculty News</a></li><li class="menu-42493 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-student-work   even  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/student-work"  title="">Student News</a></li><li class="menu-18626 menu-path-node-363446   odd  "><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/distinguished-lecture-series"  title="">Distinguished Lectures</a></li><li class="menu-19384 menu-path-node-379901   even   last "><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/lecturer-application"  title="">Lecturer Positions</a></li></ul></li></ul>

  </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes" >CLASSES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												HL90CH: Computers and American Culture											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-761241" class="node node-class article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Fall</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2016</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong>Jennifer Schnepf</span><br /><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Tuesday, 2-4</span><span style="font-size:small"><strong></strong></span></p>
<p><span style="font-size:small"><img height="126" width="162" style="float: left;" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/screen_shot_2016-07-18_at_11.43.04_am.png?m=1468856640&amp;itok=a3cdDskH" alt="" title="" />This course introduces students to digital culture in the United States after 1945. In the span of only a few decades, the role of computers in American society dramatically transformed from a complex tool serving the aims of the military to a children’s toy found in the domestic space of the American home. How did authors and filmmakers make sense of this dramatic transformation? We will engage with cultural sources ranging from classic midcentury novels and educational films, to Looney Tunes cartoons and DC Comics in order to formulate answers to this question. Course includes film screenings and field trips.</span></p></div></div></div><section class="field field-name-field-class-link field-type-link-field field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Link:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://canvas.harvard.edu/courses/16917" >Course website</a></div></div></section>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1434649112" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1434649112"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Worksheets &amp; Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434649112' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	The following advising tools help guide students in reflecting on their goals and the coherence of their individualized work in the concentration. Concentrators complete these forms in consultation with their tutors.
</p>

<ul><li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-worksheets" style="text-decoration:none">Field Worksheets</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#POC-form" style="text-decoration:none">Plan of Concentration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-declaration-form" style="text-decoration:none">Field Declaration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#modern-world-proposal" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#subfield-form" style="text-decoration:none">Subfield Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#thesis-request" style="text-decoration:none">Senior Thesis Interests Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#petition" style="text-decoration:none">Petition Form</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	Visit the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" style="text-decoration:none">Forms</a> page for a step-by-step guide to these materials and their role in a student's progress through the concentration.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>
		<!--footer region beg-->
		<footer id="footer" class="clearfix" role="contentinfo">

					<!--header regions beg-->

			 <div id="header-container">

					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1423258810" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1423258810"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

				  <!--main menu region beg-->
		  <div id="menu-bar" class="nav region-menu-bar clearfix"><nav id="block-os-primary-menu" class="block block-os no-title menu-wrapper menu-bar-wrapper clearfix"  module="os" delta="primary-menu">  
  
  <ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-primary-menu" id="nice-menu-primary-menu"><li class="menu-18550 menu-path-front  first   odd  "><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" class="menu-18620 menu-path-node-363416  first   odd  "><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/since-1906"  title="">Since 1906</a></li><li class="menu-21034 menu-path-node-426411   even  "><a 		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes" >CLASSES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												HL90CJ: Literature and Design											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-761301" class="node node-class article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Spring</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2017</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong>David J. Alworth</span><br /><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Wednesday, 3-5</span></p><p><img height="132" width="161" style="float: left;" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/screen_shot_2016-11-29_at_2.35.29_pm.png?m=1480448252&amp;itok=tkYAnvju" alt="" title="" /><span style="font-size:small">This course tracks the history of design from the Industrial Revolution to the digital revolution in the United States, and it gives sustained attention to the relationship between this history and American literature, broadly conceived. At least since Edgar Allan Poe published his “Philosophy of Furniture” in 1840, American authors have engaged with the objects and ideas of design thinking. Such engagement has taken many different forms since the mid-nineteenth century: simultaneous attraction to and repulsion from the technological, the industrial, and the machine; obsession with the distinctions among art, craft, and decoration; fascination with cities as designed spaces and with literary art as a designed (if not exactly designer) thing; and attention to the poetics of fashion, advertising, shopping, décor, bric-a-brac, trash, and other superficial matters.</span></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1434649112" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1434649112"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Worksheets &amp; Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434649112' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	The following advising tools help guide students in reflecting on their goals and the coherence of their individualized work in the concentration. Concentrators complete these forms in consultation with their tutors.
</p>

<ul><li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-worksheets" style="text-decoration:none">Field Worksheets</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#POC-form" style="text-decoration:none">Plan of Concentration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-declaration-form" style="text-decoration:none">Field Declaration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#modern-world-proposal" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#subfield-form" style="text-decoration:none">Subfield Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#thesis-request" style="text-decoration:none">Senior Thesis Interests Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#petition" style="text-decoration:none">Petition Form</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	Visit the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" style="text-decoration:none">Forms</a> page for a step-by-step guide to these materials and their role in a student's progress through the concentration.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes" >CLASSES</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												HL90CK: Beauty and Power: Race and Gender in the 20th and 21st Centuries											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-761246" class="node node-class article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Fall</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2016</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Instructor: </strong>Genevieve Clutario</span><br /><span style="font-size:small"><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Tuesday, 2-4</span></p>
<p><span style="font-size:small"><img height="134" width="162" style="float: left;" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/screen_shot_2016-07-18_at_11.44.15_am.png?m=1468856798&amp;itok=7R6cLSWJ" alt="" title="" />This course examines processes of defining beauty through both cultural productions and historical works during the 20th and 21st Centuries. We will explore how beauty is used to manage bodies, define social hierarchies, and gain or maintain power. We will also investigate how presentations of beauty could also be used as forms of subversion and resistance. Looking at sites such beauty pageants, cosmetic consumer cultures, drag performances, cosmetic surgery, and the transnational production and consumption of beauty vloggers we will investigate how race, gender, sexuality, and class informs definitions of beauty and how definitions of beauty inform constructions of race, gender, sexuality, and class.</span></p></div></div></div><section class="field field-name-field-class-link field-type-link-field field-label-above view-mode-full"><h2 class="field-label">Link:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://canvas.harvard.edu/courses/16946" >Course website</a></div></div></section>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1434649112" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1434649112"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Worksheets &amp; Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434649112' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	The following advising tools help guide students in reflecting on their goals and the coherence of their individualized work in the concentration. Concentrators complete these forms in consultation with their tutors.
</p>

<ul><li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-worksheets" style="text-decoration:none">Field Worksheets</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#POC-form" style="text-decoration:none">Plan of Concentration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-declaration-form" style="text-decoration:none">Field Declaration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#modern-world-proposal" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#subfield-form" style="text-decoration:none">Subfield Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#thesis-request" style="text-decoration:none">Senior Thesis Interests Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#petition" style="text-decoration:none">Petition Form</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	Visit the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" style="text-decoration:none">Forms</a> page for a step-by-step guide to these materials and their role in a student's progress through the concentration.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>
