  <div class="views-row views-row-6 views-row-even">
    <article id="node-453281" class="node node-class node-teaser article clearfix" role="article">
  
      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/fall2015/hl90bo-sports-and-empire" rel="bookmark">HL90BO: Sports and Empire</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <section class="field field-name-field-semester field-type-list-text field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Semester:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Spring</div></div></section><section class="field field-name-field-offered-year field-type-datetime field-label-inline clearfix view-mode-teaser"><h2 class="field-label">Offered:&nbsp;</h2><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">2017</span></div></div></section><div class="field field-name-field-class-link field-type-link-field field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://canvas.harvard.edu/courses/4891" >Course website</a></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span style="font-size: small;"><strong>Instructor: </strong>Daniel Loss</span><br /><span style="font-size: small;"><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Thursday, 1-3</span></p><p><img height="105" width="161" style="float: left;" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-small" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_small/public/histlit/files/screen_shot_2016-11-29_at_2.29.28_pm.png?m=1480447872&amp;itok=LnDtbKKz" alt="" title="" /><span style="font-size: small;">Why do American sports differ from the rest of the world?  How did soccer become a global sport?</span></p> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes/fall2015/hl90bo-sports-and-empire" class="node-readmore">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about HL90BO: Sports and Empire</span></a></div></div></div>  </div>

      <h2 class="element-invisible">Pages</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="pager"><li class="pager-first"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes">first</a></li><li class="pager-previous"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes?page=1">«</a></li><li class="pager-item"><a title="Go to page 1" href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes">1</a></li><li class="pager-item"><a title="Go to page 2" href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes?page=1">2</a></li><li class="pager-current">3</li><li class="pager-item"><a title="Go to page 4" href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes?page=3">4</a></li><li class="pager-next"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes?page=3">»</a></li><li class="pager-last"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/classes?page=3">last</a></li></ul></div>

								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1434649112" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1434649112"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Worksheets &amp; Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434649112' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	The following advising tools help guide students in reflecting on their goals and the coherence of their individualized work in the concentration. Concentrators complete these forms in consultation with their tutors.
</p>

<ul><li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-worksheets" style="text-decoration:none">Field Worksheets</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#POC-form" style="text-decoration:none">Plan of Concentration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-declaration-form" style="text-decoration:none">Field Declaration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#modern-world-proposal" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#subfield-form" style="text-decoration:none">Subfield Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#thesis-request" style="text-decoration:none">Senior Thesis Interests Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#petition" style="text-decoration:none">Petition Form</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	Visit the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" style="text-decoration:none">Forms</a> page for a step-by-step guide to these materials and their role in a student's progress through the concentration.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>
		<!--footer region beg-->
		<footer id="footer" class="clearfix" role="contentinfo">
		<!-- Three column 3x33 Gpanel -->
		
			<div class="at-panel gpanel panel-display footer clearfix">

			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1423258810" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1423258810"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1423258810' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/"><img height="66" width="475" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-large" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_large/public/histlit/files/hlbanner1.png?m=1435681341&amp;itok=YHiT_esd" alt="" title="" /></a></p></div></div></div>

Non-Profit</a></li><li class="menu-48425 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-medicine   odd  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/medicine" >Medicine</a></li><li class="menu-48427         </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">

Adler</span><br /><span style="font-size: small;"><strong>Meeting time: </strong>Wednesday, 3-5</span></p>&#13;

      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">

        </h1>
          </header>

								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1434649112" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1434649112"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Worksheets &amp; Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434649112' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	The following advising tools help guide students in reflecting on their goals and the coherence of their individualized work in the concentration. Concentrators complete these forms in consultation with their tutors.
</p>

<ul><li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-worksheets" style="text-decoration:none">Field Worksheets</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#POC-form" style="text-decoration:none">Plan of Concentration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#field-declaration-form" style="text-decoration:none">Field Declaration Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#modern-world-proposal" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#subfield-form" style="text-decoration:none">Subfield Proposal Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#thesis-request" style="text-decoration:none">Senior Thesis Interests Form</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms#petition" style="text-decoration:none">Petition Form</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	Visit the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" style="text-decoration:none">Forms</a> page for a step-by-step guide to these materials and their role in a student's progress through the concentration.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->

			<div class="at-panel gpanel panel-display footer clearfix">
												<div class="region region-footer"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1434379136" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1434379136"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434379136' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><span style="font-family:book antiqua,palatino"><span style="font-size:x-large"><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/"><br />Committee on Degrees in History &amp; Literature</a><span style="color:#ffffff"><br /></span></span><span style="font-size:medium; color:#c0c0c0">Barker Center 122 | 12 Quincy Street | Cambridge, MA 02138</span></span><br /><span style="font-family:book antiqua,palatino"><span style="font-size:medium; color:#c0c0c0">617-49</span><span style="color:#c0c0c0"><span style="font-size:medium">5-4</span><span style="font-size:medium">029 | </span><span style="font-size:medium"><a href="mailto:histlit@fas.harvard.edu"><span style="color:#c0c0c0">histlit [at] fas.harvard.edu</span></a></span></span><span style="font-size:medium"></span><span style="font-size:medium; color:#c0c0c0"><br /></span></span></p></div></div></div>

										The URL might be incorrect or have changed.  Please go back to the <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >homepage</a>									</div>
								
							</div><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-solr-search-box" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_search_solr_search_box no-title"  module="boxes" delta="solr_search_box"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-solr_search_box' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><form class="search-block-form" action="/collections/middle-grade" method="post" id="search-block-form" accept-charset="UTF-8"><div><div class="container-inline">
  <div class="form-item form-type-textfield form-item-search-block-form">

		</div>

menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-law   even  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/law" >Law</a></li><li class="menu-48429 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-business-and-finance   odd  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/business-and-finance" >Business &amp; Finance</a></li><li class="menu-48432 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-academia-and-education   even   last "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/academia-and-education" >Academia &amp; Education</a></li></ul></li><li class="menu-42489 menuparent  menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-headlines   odd   last "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/headlines" >Headlines</a><span class="open-submenu"></span><ul><li class="menu-42491 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-faculty-publications  first   odd  "><a   </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<div id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																								
																	<div id="content">
										The URL might be incorrect or have changed.  Please go back to the <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >homepage</a>									</div>
								
							</div><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-recent-graduates  first   odd  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/recent-graduates" >Recent Graduates</a></li><li class="menu-48418   </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/the-concentration" >THE CONCENTRATION</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Courses That Count                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-363146" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	The following courses count for concentration credit in the fields of History &amp; Literature. In most cases, this means that at least 50% of the material in the course relates directly to a distribution requirement or field.
</p>

<h3>
	<a name="field" id="field"></a>
</h3>

<ul class="anchor-list"><li>
		<a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/CTC-ethnic-studies" style="text-decoration:none" title="">Ethnic Studies</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/CTC-america" style="text-decoration:none" title="">American Studies</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/CTC-latin-america" style="text-decoration:none">Latin American Studies</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/CTC-europe" style="text-decoration:none">European Studies</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/CTC-medieval-world" style="text-decoration:none">Medieval World</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/CTC-early-modern" style="text-decoration:none">Early Modern World</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/modern-world" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	If you find a course that you think is well-suited to your own particular course of study, but that does not appear on the list, you may submit a Petition. If you have any questions about courses or concentration credits, please speak with one of the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/people/people/administrative-team" style="text-decoration:none">Assistant Directors of Studies</a>.
</p>

<p>
	All History &amp; Literature concentrators, regardless of field, may count one Arts &amp; Humanities course (including Humanities Pathways, Frameworks, Colloquia: Essential Texts, Essential Questions, and Studio) OR one <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/hl90s" style="text-decoration:none">HL90 Seminar</a> not in the student’s field for concentration credit as an elective.
</p>

<ul><li>
		The <a href="http://artsandhumanities.fas.harvard.edu/book/humanities-10a-and-10b-humanities-colloquium-essential-works-1-2" style="text-decoration:none" target="_blank">Humanities Colloquium </a>courses include:

		<ul><li>
				Humanities 10a. <em>Essential Works in the Western Tradition 1</em>.
			</li>
			<li>
				Humanities 10b. <em>Essential Works in the Western Tradition 2</em>.
			</li>
		</ul></li>
	<li>
		The <a href="http://artsandhumanities.fas.harvard.edu/pages/pathways" style="text-decoration:none" target="_blank">Frameworks in the Humanities</a> courses include:
		<ul><li>
				Humanities 11a. <em>The Art of Looking</em>.
			</li>
			<li>
				Humanities 11b. <em>The Art of Listening</em>.
			</li>
			<li>
				Humanities 11c. <em>The Art of Reading</em>.
			</li>
		</ul></li>
	<li>
		The <a href="http://artsandhumanities.fas.harvard.edu/pages/pathways" style="text-decoration:none" target="_blank">Pathways in the Humanities</a> courses include:
		<ul><li>
				Humanities 12. <em>Essential Works in World Literature</em>.
			</li>
			<li>
				Humanities 52. <em>Human History</em>.
			</li>
			<li>
				Humanities 53. <em>Revolution, Reform and Conservatism in Western Culture</em>.
			</li>
			<li>
				Humanities 54. <em>The Urban Imagination</em>.
			</li>
		</ul></li>
</ul></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

								  <!--sidebar first region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-first sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/junior" >Junior Tutorial</a></li><li class="collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-88976"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/senior" >Senior Tutorial</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-88931"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/hl90s" >HL90 Seminars</a></li><li class="leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-88996"><a Funding</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-197981"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/study-abroad" >Study Abroad</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-197986"><a >Calendar</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-89001"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/forms" >Forms</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-109431"><a   </div></div></div></div>				  <!--sidebar first region end-->
        
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1442274414" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1442274414"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Previous Courses that Count</h2>

</div>

<div>
	<a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/latin_american_studies_ctc_-_website.docx" style="text-decoration:none">2016-2017 (Latin American Studies)</a>
</div>

	<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/courses_that_count_non-america_15-16_master_list_spring.docx" style="text-decoration:none"><span style="text-decoration:none">2015-2016 (Non-America fields)</span></a><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/ctc_america_2015-16.docx" style="text-decoration:none"> </a><br /><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/august_courses_that_count_non-america_fields_2013-2014_ii.docx" style="text-decoration:none">2015-2016 (Postcolonial)</a><br /><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/ctc_america_2014-15_-_new.pdf" style="text-decoration:none">2014-2015 (America field)</a><br /><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/2014-15_non-america_class_of_2017.docx" style="text-decoration:none">2014-2015 (Non-America fields)</a><br /><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/2013-2014_america_field_electives_and_requirements.docx" style="text-decoration:none">2013-2014 (America field)</a><br /><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/2013-14_non-america_fields.docx" style="text-decoration:none">2013-2014 (Non-America fields)</a>

			<div class="at-panel gpanel panel-display footer clearfix">
												<div class="region region-footer"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1434379136" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1434379136"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1434379136' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><span style="font-family:book antiqua,palatino"><span style="font-size:x-large"><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/"><br />Committee on Degrees in History &amp; Literature</a><span style="color:#ffffff"><br /></span></span><span style="font-size:medium; color:#c0c0c0">Barker Center 122 | 12 Quincy Street | Cambridge, MA 02138</span></span><br /><span style="font-family:book antiqua,palatino"><span style="font-size:medium; color:#c0c0c0">617-49</span><span style="color:#c0c0c0"><span style="font-size:medium">5-4</span><span style="font-size:medium">029 | </span><span style="font-size:medium"><a href="mailto:histlit@fas.harvard.edu"><span style="color:#c0c0c0">histlit [at] fas.harvard.edu</span></a></span></span><span style="font-size:medium"></span><span style="font-size:medium; color:#c0c0c0"><br /></span></span></p></div></div></div>

																	<div id="content">
										The URL might be incorrect or have changed.  Please go back to the <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >homepage</a>									</div>
								
							</div><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/business-and-finance" >Business &amp; Finance</a></li><li class="menu-48432 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-academia-and-education   even   last "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/academia-and-education" >Academia &amp; Education</a></li></ul></li><li class="menu-42489 menuparent  menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-headlines   odd   last "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/headlines" >Headlines</a><span class="open-submenu"></span><ul><li class="menu-42491 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-faculty-publications  first   odd  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/faculty-publications"  title="">Faculty News</a></li><li class="menu-42493 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-student-work   even  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/student-work"  title="">Student News</a></li><li class="menu-18626 menu-path-node-363446   odd  "><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/distinguished-lecture-series"  title="">Distinguished Lectures</a></li><li class="menu-19384 menu-path-node-379901   even   last "><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/lecturer-application"  title="">Lecturer Positions</a></li></ul></li></ul>

  </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<div id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																								
																	<div id="content">
										The URL might be incorrect or have changed.  Please go back to the <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >homepage</a>									</div>
								
							</div><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

  </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<div id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																								
																	<div id="content">
										The URL might be incorrect or have changed.  Please go back to the <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >homepage</a>									</div>
								
							</div><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

  </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<div id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																								
																	<div id="content">
										The URL might be incorrect or have changed.  Please go back to the <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >homepage</a>									</div>
								
							</div><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

					<!--header regions beg-->

					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1423258810" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1423258810"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

		  <div id="menu-bar" class="nav region-menu-bar clearfix"><nav id="block-os-primary-menu" class="block block-os no-title menu-wrapper menu-bar-wrapper clearfix"  module="os" delta="primary-menu">

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<div id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																								
																	<div id="content">
										The URL might be incorrect or have changed.  Please go back to the <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >homepage</a>									</div>

					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1423258810" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1423258810"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1423258810' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/"><img height="66" width="475" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-large" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_large/public/histlit/files/hlbanner1.png?m=1435681341&amp;itok=YHiT_esd" alt="" title="" /></a></p></div></div></div>

				  <!--main menu region beg-->
		  <div id="menu-bar" class="nav region-menu-bar clearfix"><nav id="block-os-primary-menu" class="block block-os no-title menu-wrapper menu-bar-wrapper clearfix"  module="os" delta="primary-menu">  
  
  <ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-primary-menu" id="nice-menu-primary-menu"><li class="menu-18550 menu-path-front  first   odd  "><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >Home</a></li><li class="menu-18642 menuparent  menu-path-node-363656   even  "><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/learn-more"  title="">Learn More</a><span class="open-submenu"></span><ul><li 		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">

				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>

								<a name="main-content"></a>
																								
																	<div id="content">
										The URL might be incorrect or have changed.  Please go back to the <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >homepage</a>									</div>

<div id="page" class="container page header-main content-none footer">

              <div class="menu-utility-menu-container"><ul id="menu-utility-menu-1" class="utility-menu"><li class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-200106"><a href="http://www.harvard.edu" onclick="dataLayer.push({'eventCategory': 'nav_utility_left', 'eventAction': 'nav_link', 'eventLabel': 'http://www.harvard.edu','event': 'gaEvent'});">harvard.edu</a></li>

  <div class="content full-width-top feature-photo-top">
      <div class="top-wrapper feature-top">
      <div class="article-head">
        <div class="breadcrumb category Campus &amp; Community">
          <a class="category-name campus" data-category="breadcrumb" data-action="category" href="https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/section/campus-n-community/" title="View all posts in Campus &amp; Community" rel="&quot;category&quot;">Campus &amp; Community</a> &nbsp;&gt;&nbsp; <a data-category="breadcrumb" data-action="sub_category" href="https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/section/campus-n-community/commencement-campus-n-community/" title="View all posts in Commencement" rel="&quot;category&quot;">Commencement</a>        </div>
        <h1 class="headline" itemprop="AlternativeHeadline AlternateName">
                    Meet the student orators        </h1>

        <p class="sub-headline large">Their planned speeches explain how to overcome fear, remain hopeful, and stay bewildered</p>

        <div
          class="meta"> May 22, 2017 | 
		        <span class="label editorpick">Editor's Pick</span> </div>
        <!--/.meta-->
      </div>
      <!--/.article-head -->

              <div class="article-feature"><img src="https://harvardgazette.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/052412_com_sm_1328_232669-605.jpg" alt="Commencement 2012" class="feature-photo" /></div>
        <!--/.article-feature -->
                    <div class="article-feature-caption tablet">
          <p class="photo-credit">File photo by Stephanie Mitchell/Harvard Staff Photographer</p>
                      <p class="photo-description">Commencement Day student orators Auguste "Gussie" Roc, Jessica Glueck, and Walter Smelt III were chosen in a speech-writing competition to address Harvard’s Class of 2017. </p>
            <div class="toggle-more-less"><a href="#" class="show-more">Show more</a></div>
                  </div>
        <!--/.article-feature-caption-->
          </div>
    <!--/.top-wrapper-->

    <div class="main">
                  <div class="split-2-1 clearfix">
        <div class="col first">
          <div
            class="article-byline"> By Liz Mineo, Harvard Staff Writer </div>
        </div>
        <!--/.col-->
        <div class="col last">
          <div
            class="option-icons article-social-share"> 
	         <span class="email_span"><a class="email" target="_blank" href="mailto:?subject=Harvard%20Gazette:%20Meet%20the%20student%20orators&amp;body=Three%20student%20orators%2C%20Auguste%20%28Gussie%29%20Roc%2C%20Jessica%20Glueck%2C%20and%20Walter%20Smelt%20III%2C%20were%20chosen%20in%20a%20speech-writing%20competition%20to%20address%20Harvard%E2%80%99s%20Class%20of%202017.%20%0D%0A%0D%0ARead%20More:%20http%3A%2F%2Fnews.harvard.edu%2Fgazette%2Fstory%2F2017%2F05%2Fmeet-the-student-orators-for-harvards-366th-commencement%2F" title="Email" data-category="email" data-sociallink="Meet+the+student+orators+for+Harvard%26%238217%3Bs+366th+Commencement">Email</a></span>
            <span class="twitter_span"><a class="twitter" target="_blank" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Meet+the+student+orators+for+Harvard%27s+366th+Commencement&amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fnews.harvard.edu%2Fgazette%2Fstory%2F2017%2F05%2Fmeet-the-student-orators-for-harvards-366th-commencement%2F&amp;via=harvard" title="Twitter" data-category="twitter" data-sociallink="Meet+the+student+orators+for+Harvard%26%238217%3Bs+366th+Commencement">Twitter</a></span>
            <span class="facebook_span"><a class="facebook" target="_blank" href="https://www.facebook.com/dialog/share?app_id=135898969862440&amp;display=popup&amp;href=http%3A%2F%2Fnews.harvard.edu%2Fgazette%2Fstory%2F2017%2F05%2Fmeet-the-student-orators-for-harvards-366th-commencement%2F&amp;redirect_uri=http%3A%2F%2Fnews.harvard.edu%2Fgazette%2Fstory%2F2017%2F05%2Fmeet-the-student-orators-for-harvards-366th-commencement%2F" title="Facebook" data-category="facebook" data-sociallink="Meet+the+student+orators+for+Harvard%26%238217%3Bs+366th+Commencement">Facebook</a></span>
 </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <!--/.split-2-1-->

      <div class="article-body">
        <p><span class="initial-cap">C</span>ontinuing a cherished tradition that dates back more than 360 years, three students will deliver orations to the Class of 2017 during Morning Exercises at Commencement.</p>
<p>The students, who were chosen by a panel of judges during a speech-writing competition, are two Harvard College seniors and a graduate student from <a href="http://hds.harvard.edu">Harvard Divinity School</a>. They will deliver their orations, one in Latin and two in English, before graduates, family, friends, and members of the Harvard community in Tercentenary Theatre.</p>
<p>Once, students delivered orations to defend their theses. But now they seek to inspire their peers with messages of encouragement. This year’s topics address how to overcome fear, how to remain hopeful, and how to be properly bewildered.</p>
<p>Here are this year’s orators:</p>
<figure id="attachment_225646" style="width: 605px" class="wp-caption alignnone"><img data-attachment-id="225646" data-permalink="https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2017/05/meet-the-student-orators-for-harvards-366th-commencement/commencement-student-speaker-jessica-rachael-glueck/" data-orig-file="https://harvardgazette.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/050517_glueck_3620_605.jpg?w=605&#038;h=403" data-orig-size="605,403" data-comments-opened="0" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;2.8&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;Harvard University&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;Canon EOS 5D Mark III&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;Jessica Rachael Glueck is the student in charge of delivering the Latin oration at Harvard University&#039;s Commencement\r\r\r\r\r\rRose Lincoln\/Harvard Staff Photographer&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;1494001062&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;\u00a9 2016 The President and Fellows of Harvard College&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;70&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;400&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0.0015625&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Commencement Student Speaker (Jessica Rachael Glueck)&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}" data-image-title="Commencement Student Speaker (Jessica Rachael Glueck)" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://harvardgazette.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/050517_glueck_3620_605.jpg?w=605&#038;h=403?w=300" data-large-file="https://harvardgazette.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/050517_glueck_3620_605.jpg?w=605&#038;h=403?w=605" class="size-full wp-image-225646" src="https://harvardgazette.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/050517_glueck_3620_605.jpg?w=605&#038;h=403" alt="" width="605" height="403" srcset="https://harvardgazette.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/050517_glueck_3620_605.jpg 605w, https://harvardgazette.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/050517_glueck_3620_605.jpg?w=150&amp;h=100 150w, https://harvardgazette.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/050517_glueck_3620_605.jpg?w=300&amp;h=200 300w" sizes="(max-width: 605px) 100vw, 605px" /><figcaption class="wp-caption-text">Rose Lincoln/Harvard Staff Photographer</figcaption></figure>
<p><strong>Jessica Rachael Glueck, Latin speaker</strong></p>
<p>Jessica Glueck ’17 traces her love for Latin back to high school. Sitting around the dinner table in her hometown of Leawood, a Kansas City suburb, Glueck’s father would preach the benefits of learning Latin as a way to understand English better. Glueck obliged and signed up for a class in the language, which she grew to love.</p>
<p>Fast forward to today.</p>
<p>An English concentrator with a secondary in classics, Glueck will give the Latin oration. She still can’t believe it. Neither can her father.</p>
<p>“I was talking to my dad the other day,” said Glueck during an interview at the coffee shop at the Harvard Art Museums, one of her favorite campus hangouts. “If someone would have told us when I was in high school that I’d be at Harvard, and I’d be giving the Latin oration, neither of us would have believed it. It went further than either of us ever expected.”</p>
<p>Like a modern Latin poet, Glueck will address her class outdoors, in Tercentenary Theatre, to sing the praises of her Harvard years as they come to an end. In her speech, “<em>Epos Imperfectus,”</em> “The Unfinished Epic,” she plans to eulogize the quest for learning, the callings found, and the friendships she and her classmates formed over four years.</p>
<p>But unlike Ovid and other ancient Roman poets whom she learned to admire, Glueck plans to include an admonition that she hopes will help her fellow graduating seniors. It is a message inspired by Virgil, who on his deathbed ordered his masterpiece “The Aeneid” to be burned because, in his view, it was unfinished.</p>
<p>“Even if we stand at the end of our Harvard years, some of us may be thinking of things we would have done differently, of things we’d like to go back and change,” she said. “But it’s good to remember that this is actually the first book of our epic, and that we could do better in the next book.”</p>
<p>Glueck’s next book, for instance, will start in September, when she will begin classics studies at the University of Oxford. She hopes eventually to teach Latin and English to inspire others to study the classics, which, she said, can enrich people’s understanding of today’s world. “Classic antiquity is an intellectual touchstone for so many different cultures,” she said.</p>
<p>Learning Latin helped Glueck become a better writer, she said, by familiarizing her with the roots of words, syntax, and clauses. In the process, she also read books that delved into a broad range of human emotions and desires that still resonate today, and was delighted by the authors’ wit.<br />
“People forget the ancients have a great sense of humor,” she said.</p>
<p>Echoing that trait, Glueck will inject humor into her speech, which the audience will be able to follow because the Latin text will be accompanied by an English translation in the Commencement program. “Some people may think Latin is a language of somber philosophy, but it’s not,” said Glueck. “It’s such a triumph to be able to communicate in a language that we no longer speak.”</p>
<p>The Mather House resident said her message will be that the best is yet to come, or as she says in Latin, “<em>Opus nostrum solum hodie incipit</em>” — “Our masterpiece only begins today.”</p>
<figure id="attachment_225642" style="width: 605px" class="wp-caption alignnone"><img data-attachment-id="225642" data-permalink="https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2017/05/meet-the-student-orators-for-harvards-366th-commencement/commencement-student-speaker-auguste-jennings-roc/" data-orig-file="https://harvardgazette.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/050217_roc_gussie_190_605.jpg?w=605&#038;h=403" data-orig-size="605,403" data-comments-opened="0" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;1.8&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;Harvard University&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;Canon EOS 5D Mark III&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;Auguste Jennings Roc will deliver the Senior English Address at Harvard Commencement. She is pictured in the Signet Society, a gathering place for artists and writers, where she is the Undergraduate President. Stephanie Mitchell\/Harvard Staff Photographer&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;1493739878&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;\u00a9 2017 The President and Fellows of Harvard College&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;85&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;1250&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0.016666666666667&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Commencement Student Speaker (Auguste Jennings Roc)&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;1&quot;}" data-image-title="Commencement Student Speaker (Auguste Jennings Roc)" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://harvardgazette.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/050217_roc_gussie_190_605.jpg?w=605&#038;h=403?w=300" data-large-file="https://harvardgazette.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/050217_roc_gussie_190_605.jpg?w=605&#038;h=403?w=605" class="size-full wp-image-225642" src="https://harvardgazette.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/050217_roc_gussie_190_605.jpg?w=605&#038;h=403" alt="" width="605" height="403" srcset="https://harvardgazette.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/050217_roc_gussie_190_605.jpg 605w, https://harvardgazette.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/050217_roc_gussie_190_605.jpg?w=150&amp;h=100 150w, https://harvardgazette.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/050217_roc_gussie_190_605.jpg?w=300&amp;h=200 300w" sizes="(max-width: 605px) 100vw, 605px" /><figcaption class="wp-caption-text">Stephanie Mitchell/Harvard Staff Photographer</figcaption></figure>
<p><strong>Auguste &#8220;Gussie&#8221; Roc, undergraduate speaker</strong></p>
<p>Gussie Roc ’17 drew inspiration for her Commencement speech from two startling events that left a mark on her life and the lives of her graduating classmates.</p>
<p>Like most of her peers, Roc was in first grade when the Sept. 11 terror attacks took place. And like most of them, she was a high school senior when the Boston Marathon bombings happened. The attacks marked the beginning and the end of the Class of 2017’s elementary and secondary school years, and brought uncertainty and fear into their lives.</p>
<p>In her speech, “When We Fall in One Piece,” Roc will talk about the ways fear can be overcome.</p>
<p>“Having gone through these difficult moments or scary times,” said Roc, a Pforzheimer resident, “I realized that what’s important is to recognize each other’s humanity and understand that whether or not we have commonalities, we’re one people.”</p>
<p>A Brooklyn native, Roc said that seeing acts of compassion and bravery in the midst of those two attacks helped her to “take every day as a blessing” and “try to be somebody who does active good in the world.”</p>
<p>An American history and literature concentrator, Roc plans to pursue a career in filmmaking or screenwriting. At Harvard, she rediscovered a love for films and writing after trying classes in government, economics, and statistics, and finding out they were not for her. In her sophomore year, she co-directed the Harvard College Film Festival, and in the summer of 2014 she traveled to Berlin as a film studies and production student. She also worked as a producer at the Harvard Radcliffe Dramatic Club, served as a leader at the Freshman Arts Program, and as a president of the Signet Society, a social club where students and faculty celebrate the arts and humanities.</p>
<p>Fanning her passions, she took courses on playwriting, screenwriting, and autobiography and memoir, and she wrote a play she performed in class, one of the highlights of her College years. “I came full circle,” she said. “I went back to the things I wanted to pursue from the beginning.”</p>
<p>She hopes to write screenplays about stories and people overlooked by mainstream culture and off the beaten path. Two films that she finds inspiring are “Beasts of the Southern Wild” and “Little Miss Sunshine,” small independent movies that were highly acclaimed by critics and had success in the box office.</p>
<p>“For everyone who feels their story doesn’t matter,” she said, “there are examples out there of stories that might have not been told. Not only can those stories be told, but also they can be successful at the box office and show the diversity of life.”</p>
<p>After graduation, Roc plans to move to New York or Los Angeles and write a screenplay that tells an important story about an unnoticed topic or marginalized people. She will depart with her best memories of Harvard, including the friendships she made and the courses that reignited her vocation in the arts. She will remember seeing towering figures such as Civil Rights leader and U.S. Rep. John Lewis and Pakistani education activist Malala Yousafzai, both of whom stood “in the face of fear.” She’ll also remember having given a speech to her departing classmates.</p>
<p>“It’s an honor,” she said. “But what’s really important for me is that my speech talks about how our basic humanity is being threatened, and what we, as world leaders and world changers, can do to preserve it.”</p>
<figure id="attachment_225645" style="width: 605px" class="wp-caption alignnone"><img data-attachment-id="225645" data-permalink="https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2017/05/meet-the-student-orators-for-harvards-366th-commencement/commencement-student-speaker-walter-smelt-iii-2/" data-orig-file="https://harvardgazette.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/050417_smelt_100_605.jpg?w=605&#038;h=403" data-orig-size="605,403" data-comments-opened="0" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;5.6&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;Jon Chase&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;Canon EOS 5D Mark III&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;Walter Smelt III, a Divinity School graduate, will deliver the Graduate English Address. He stands on the steps of Widener Library, which he mentions in his speech.\rJon Chase\/Harvard Staff Photographer&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;1493912434&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;90&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;200&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0.003125&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Commencement Student Speaker (Walter Smelt III)&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}" data-image-title="Commencement Student Speaker (Walter Smelt III)" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://harvardgazette.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/050417_smelt_100_605.jpg?w=605&#038;h=403?w=300" data-large-file="https://harvardgazette.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/050417_smelt_100_605.jpg?w=605&#038;h=403?w=605" class="size-full wp-image-225645" src="https://harvardgazette.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/050417_smelt_100_605.jpg?w=605&#038;h=403" alt="" width="605" height="403" srcset="https://harvardgazette.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/050417_smelt_100_605.jpg 605w, https://harvardgazette.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/050417_smelt_100_605.jpg?w=150&amp;h=100 150w, https://harvardgazette.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/050417_smelt_100_605.jpg?w=300&amp;h=200 300w" sizes="(max-width: 605px) 100vw, 605px" /><figcaption class="wp-caption-text">Jon Chase/Harvard Staff Photographer</figcaption></figure>
<p><strong>Walter Smelt III, graduate speaker</strong></p>
<p>As a poet working on his first manuscript, Walter Smelt III said jokingly that he often feels like he’s talking into empty air. But Smelt, who will speak on behalf of the graduate students, will have a massive audience at Commencement.</p>
<p>It will be the second time Smelt addresses a university audience. In 2007, Smelt was the undergraduate speaker at Boston University’s commencement. He spoke then about the need to “inhabit the earth.” This year, as a graduate of the Harvard Divinity School with a master’s of theological studies in religion, literature, and culture, his planned message will be for graduates to stop being clever and instead let themselves “be bewildered.”</p>
<p>“Harvard has a tradition of excellence firmly established,” said Smelt. “But that’s all the more reason to have humility, admit the limitations of our knowledge, and the need to become bewildered. It’s important to question, and not always get the answer.”</p>
<p>It is a lesson that Smelt said he learned at the Divinity School, where there is a tradition of deep analysis alongside the accumulation of knowledge. Ethics, or knowing what’s right and what’s wrong, is equally important.</p>
<p>“At the Divinity School, I learned that there are things beyond knowledge; there is wisdom,” he said. “Science is really important, but it’s also important to remember that you can know everything in the world and not know what you shouldn’t do. There are still ethical considerations to be made.”</p>
<p>Smelt, who earned a master’s in creative writing from the University of Florida in Gainesville, came to the Divinity School to look at literature from the perspective of faith and to explore the intersection of religion and literature, both of which have long been part of his life.</p>
<p>Growing up in a religious family in West Palm Beach, Fla., Smelt became fascinated by books, including the Bible, which he saw both as a sacred document and as a wondrous piece of literature with “tremendous power to shape people’s lives.”</p>
<p>A high school teacher introduced him to poetry, and Smelt found a passion. He is working on a book of poems, many of which deal with religious subjects such as the exploration of faith and doubt, and which exhibit religious imagery. “Religion keeps finding its way in my poems,” he said.</p>
<p>Smelt hopes to teach creative writing in the future. Meantime, he tries to practice what he preaches and let himself be bewildered. He keeps himself connected to the real world, outside the ivory tower, by dog sitting, working at an after-school program, and freelancing as a writer.</p>
<p>“It’s important to me to recognize the limits of my knowledge,” he said, “and go out, do some good, and engage with the world.”</p>

		<div class="next-story nocontent">
	<div class="story-block clearfix ">
		<div class="story-photo">
			<a href="https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2017/05/70-years-ago-a-harvard-commencement-speech-outlined-the-marshall-plan-and-calmed-a-continent/" data-category="next" data-action="img"><img src="https://harvardgazette.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/140_header-copy.jpg" alt="Birth of a peaceful Europe" /></a>
		</div><!--/.story-photo-->

		<div class="cat-icon campus"><a href="https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/section/campus-n-community/">View all posts in Campus &amp; Community</a></div>
		<div class="story-info">

			<div class="date">
			<span class="byline">By Colleen Walsh, Harvard Staff Writer <span class="divider">|</span> </span>May 22, 2017
			</div>

      s.parentNode.insertBefore(jl, s);
    }
  }
}catch(e){}
})();

  <script>

    jQuery(window).scroll(function () {

      if (getInternetExplorerVersion() != 8) {
        var $totalHeight = jQuery('.sticky').outerHeight() + jQuery('#logo').outerHeight() + jQuery('.top-wrapper').outerHeight() + jQuery('.feature-photo-side .article-feature').outerHeight() + jQuery('.full-width-layout .article-head.feature-top').outerHeight() + jQuery('.full-width-layout .article-feature').outerHeight() + 10;

        var scroll_top = jQuery(window).scrollTop();

        if (scroll_top <= $totalHeight) {
          jQuery('#sticky-filter').hide();
        }
        if (scroll_top > $totalHeight) {
          jQuery('#sticky-filter').show();
        }
      }
    });

  </script>
<script>
  var prev_width = jQuery(window).width();
  var prev_height = jQuery(window).height();

  var inner_size = viewport();
  var prev_inner_width = inner_size['width'];

  window.onresize = function (event) {
    var w_width = jQuery(window).width();

    if (( w_width > 1242 && prev_width <= 1242 ) || ( w_width <= 1242 && prev_width > 1242 )) {
      if (( w_width > 1242 && prev_width <= 1242 )) {
        jQuery('#nav-open-btn').hide();
        jQuery('#nav-close-btn').hide();
        jQuery('#nav-open-btn').removeAttr('style');
        jQuery('#nav-close-btn').removeAttr('style');
      }
      prev_width = w_width;
    }

    var w_height = jQuery(window).height();
    if (w_height != prev_height) {
      if (use_tinyscroller()) {
        jQuery('#scrollbar1').tinyscrollbar({invertscroll: true});
      }
      else {
        set_scroller_height();
      }
    }

    //For photo description
    inner_size = viewport();
    var inner_width = inner_size['width'];
    if (inner_width > 475 && prev_inner_width <= 475) {
      jQuery('.article-feature-caption.tablet .toggle-more-less').hide();
      jQuery('.photo-description').removeAttr('style');
      prev_inner_width = inner_width;
    }
    else if (inner_width <= 475 && prev_inner_width > 475) {
      jQuery('.article-feature-caption.tablet .toggle-more-less').show();
      jQuery('.photo-description').removeAttr('style');
      prev_inner_width = inner_width;
    }
  }

</script>

<script type="text/javascript">
  var _sf_async_config = {};
  /** CONFIGURATION START **/
  _sf_async_config.uid = 2327;
  _sf_async_config.domain = "news.harvard.edu";
  _sf_async_config.sections = "Campus &amp; Community, Commencement";

  (function () {
    function loadChartbeat() {
      window._sf_endpt = (new Date()).getTime();
      var e = document.createElement("script");
      e.setAttribute("language", "javascript");
      e.setAttribute("type", "text/javascript");
      e.setAttribute("src",
        (("https:" == document.location.protocol) ?
          "https://a248.e.akamai.net/chartbeat.download.akamai.com/102508/" :
          "http://static.chartbeat.com/") +
          "js/chartbeat.js");
      document.body.appendChild(e);
    }

    var oldonload = window.onload;
    window.onload = (typeof window.onload != "function") ?
      loadChartbeat : function () {
      oldonload();
      loadChartbeat();
    };
  })();
</script>

<!-- end chartbeat code -->

	<li id="menu-item-200112" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-200112"><a href="/gazette/story/topic/global-harvard-latin-america/" onclick="dataLayer.push({'eventCategory': 'nav_main', 'eventAction': 'nav_link', 'eventLabel': '/gazette/story/topic/global-harvard-latin-america/','event': 'gaEvent'});">Global Harvard: Latin America</a></li>
	<li id="menu-item-200111" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-200111"><a href="/gazette/story/topic/asia/" onclick="dataLayer.push({'eventCategory': 'nav_main', 'eventAction': 'nav_link', 'eventLabel': '/gazette/story/topic/asia/','event': 'gaEvent'});">Global Harvard: Asia</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul></div>            
        <div class="daily-gazette">

          <img src="https://s0.wp.com/wp-content/themes/vip/gz-gazette20/a/i/mail_white_retina.png" width="28" alt="subscribe" />

      Two are Abramson winners    </div>

      class="share-icons">

  </div>
  <div class="content full-width-top feature-photo-top">
      <div class="top-wrapper feature-top">
      <div class="article-head">
        <div class="breadcrumb category Campus &amp; Community">
          <a class="category-name campus" data-category="breadcrumb" data-action="category" href="https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/section/campus-n-community/" title="View all posts in Campus &amp; Community" rel="&quot;category&quot;">Campus &amp; Community</a> &nbsp;&gt;&nbsp; <a data-category="breadcrumb" data-action="sub_category" href="https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/section/campus-n-community/awards/" title="View all posts in Awards" rel="&quot;category&quot;">Awards</a>        </div>
        <h1 class="headline" itemprop="AlternativeHeadline AlternateName">
                    Two are Abramson winners        </h1>

        <p class="sub-headline large">Cox and Peña honored for undergraduate teaching</p>

        <div
          class="meta"> May 2, 2017 | 
		        <span class="label editorpick">Editor's Pick</span> </div>
        <!--/.meta-->
      </div>
      <!--/.article-head -->

              <div class="article-feature"><img src="https://harvardgazette.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/garcicc81apencc83a_davidcox_diptych_605.jpg" alt="GarciaPena_DavidCox_Diptych_605.jpg" class="feature-photo" /></div>
        <!--/.article-feature -->
                    <div class="article-feature-caption tablet">
          <p class="photo-credit">Photos: Courtesy of the Department of Romance Languages &amp; Literature; Jon Chase/Harvard Staff Photographer</p>
                      <p class="photo-description">Lorgia García Peña and David Cox, both assistant professors with the Faculty of Arts and Sciences, have each won a 2017 Roslyn Abramson Award for excellence in undergraduate teaching.</p>
            <div class="toggle-more-less"><a href="#" class="show-more">Show more</a></div>
                  </div>
        <!--/.article-feature-caption-->
          </div>
    <!--/.top-wrapper-->

    <div class="main">
                  <div class="split-2-1 clearfix">
        <div class="col first">
          <div
            class="article-byline"> FAS Communications </div>
        </div>
        <!--/.col-->
        <div class="col last">
          <div
            class="option-icons article-social-share"> 
	         <span class="email_span"><a class="email" target="_blank" href="mailto:?subject=Harvard%20Gazette:%20Two%20are%20Abramson%20winners&amp;body=David%20Cox%20and%20Lorgia%20Garc%C3%ADa%20Pe%C3%B1a%20are%20winners%20of%20the%202017%20Roslyn%20Abramson%20Award%20for%20excellence%20in%20undergraduate%20teaching.%0D%0A%0D%0A%0D%0ARead%20More:%20http%3A%2F%2Fnews.harvard.edu%2Fgazette%2Fstory%2F2017%2F05%2Ftwo-faculty-get-abramson-award-for-excellence-in-undergrad-teaching%2F" title="Email" data-category="email" data-sociallink="Two+faculty+get+Abramson+Award+for+excellence+in+undergrad+teaching">Email</a></span>
            <span class="twitter_span"><a class="twitter" target="_blank" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Two+faculty+get+Abramson+Award+for+excellence+in+undergrad+teaching&amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fnews.harvard.edu%2Fgazette%2Fstory%2F2017%2F05%2Ftwo-faculty-get-abramson-award-for-excellence-in-undergrad-teaching%2F&amp;via=harvard" title="Twitter" data-category="twitter" data-sociallink="Two+faculty+get+Abramson+Award+for+excellence+in+undergrad+teaching">Twitter</a></span>
            <span class="facebook_span"><a class="facebook" target="_blank" href="https://www.facebook.com/dialog/share?app_id=135898969862440&amp;display=popup&amp;href=http%3A%2F%2Fnews.harvard.edu%2Fgazette%2Fstory%2F2017%2F05%2Ftwo-faculty-get-abramson-award-for-excellence-in-undergrad-teaching%2F&amp;redirect_uri=http%3A%2F%2Fnews.harvard.edu%2Fgazette%2Fstory%2F2017%2F05%2Ftwo-faculty-get-abramson-award-for-excellence-in-undergrad-teaching%2F" title="Facebook" data-category="facebook" data-sociallink="Two+faculty+get+Abramson+Award+for+excellence+in+undergrad+teaching">Facebook</a></span>
 </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <!--/.split-2-1-->

      <div class="article-body">
        <p><a href="https://www.seas.harvard.edu/directory/davidcox">David Cox</a>, assistant professor of molecular and cellular biology and of computer science, uses cutting-edge, high-performance computing techniques to teach undergraduates how the brain works. <a href="http://rll-faculty.fas.harvard.edu/garciapena/home">Lorgia García Peña</a>, assistant professor of Romance languages and literatures and of history and literature, teaches students about ethnic, race, and national identity formations through literature. This year, the two members of <a href="http://www.fas.harvard.edu/home/">Harvard’s Faculty of Arts and Sciences</a> (FAS) have something in common: They’re both winners of a 2017 Roslyn Abramson Award for excellence in undergraduate teaching.</p>
<p>“David Cox’s and Lorgia García Peña’s love of teaching exemplifies a Harvard education at its best,” said Edgerley Family Dean of the Faculty of Arts and Sciences Michael D. Smith. “Each have engaged and challenged students in the classroom and the lab, ignited students’ passion for their respective fields, and prepared them to lead in a complex world. I offer my congratulations to David and Lorgia for an honor well-deserved.”</p>
<p>The $10,000 award, established with a gift from Edward Abramson ’57 in honor of his mother, is given annually in recognition of “excellence and sensitivity in teaching undergraduates.” Recipients, drawn exclusively from FAS, are chosen on the basis of their ability to communicate with and inspire undergraduates, their accessibility, and their dedication to teaching.</p>
<p><strong>David Cox</strong></p>
<p>Cox said he was honored when he found out that he was a recipient of this year’s Abramson Award.</p>
<p>“I am grateful to my department and the Faculty of Arts and Sciences to have been given the flexibility and resources to explore new ideas in teaching so early in my career,” he said. “I’m also grateful to the students whom I’ve taught so far — their curiosity and enthusiasm makes my course a joy to teach.”</p>
<p>Cox teaches one course, “Fundamentals of Neuroscience.” It’s an intensive introduction to topics in neuroscience, ranging from the inner workings of neurons to the function of small neuronal networks to the function of brain systems that give rise to perception, thought, emotion, cognition, and action. The course is tailored for highly engaged students who are interested in pursuing a neurobiology concentration or secondary.</p>
<p>What makes this <a href="https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2016/01/the-story-of-us/">course unique</a>, however, is that it’s taught in a “flipped classroom” format.</p>
<p>“Students complete lessons from the HarvardX online version of the course outside of class, and then 100 percent of in-class time is devoted to discussion and student-driven synthesis of material,” explained Cox. “This course represents the fruition of a multiyear arc that I’ve been developing since I arrived at Harvard, aimed at fusing online and on-campus learning.”</p>
<p>In addition to reaching learners globally, HarvardX has worked to identify opportunities to leverage its online learning content in Harvard’s on-campus classes — and has helped create more than 20 blended courses at the University using HarvardX materials.</p>
<p>“I’m convinced that online courses can be a powerful tool for making the on-campus experience more personalized and interactive,” said Cox. “In my course, students get all of the nuts-and-bolts learning out of the way outside of class, using lessons that were designed to be fun, visually engaging, and easily digestible, and in-class time is all about students solidifying that knowledge and exploring topics in greater depth.”</p>
<p>As for the award money, Cox intends to use part of it as seed capital to help one of his graduate students launch a startup based on technology developed in the <a href="http://www.coxlab.org">coxlab @ Harvard University</a>.</p>
<p><strong>Lorgia García Peña</strong></p>
<p>Undergraduates find that García Peña’s “Performing Latinidad” questions Latinidad as a historical, cultural, and theoretical concept through literary and critical texts.</p>
<p>“One of the goals of the course is to provide students with an overview of the Latinx literary canon in dialogue with the various historical and social moments and movements that produced them — the War of 1898, the Jones Act of 1917, the Civil Rights Movement(s), the Delano strikes, the Zoot Suit Riots, and Operation Bootstrap,” said García Peña.</p>
<p>The course includes an art component in which the students, working in groups, produce an art piece that is then displayed throughout campus. Thanks to generous support of the Elson Family, García Peña has been able to invite artists to work with students in developing their pieces.</p>
<p>García Peña believes strongly that learning done in the classroom should not be disconnected from what is happening in the world around us.</p>
<p>“I encourage my students to read in contradiction, always looking for silences, omissions, blank spaces,” she said. “I think we all have that responsibility as scholars, and particularly as humanists, as much damage has been done by reading the same way — many histories and knowledge have been suppressed, erased from our archives to the detriment of our society.”</p>
<p>García Peña said she was incredibly humbled and grateful to her colleagues and students in accepting the award, focusing on her love of teaching and the rewards it brings.</p>
<p>“I learn so much from my students, everyday,” she said. “I am enriched by the discussion — particularly the challenging ones. It is a wonderful exchange.”</p>

		<div class="next-story nocontent">
	<div class="story-block clearfix ">
		<div class="story-photo">
			<a href="https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2017/05/a-celebration-of-harvard-artists-showcased-the-campus-arts/" data-category="next" data-action="img"><img src="https://harvardgazette.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/042817_h_artists_032_140.jpg" alt="Star turn for Harvard arts" /></a>
		</div><!--/.story-photo-->

		<div class="cat-icon arts"><a href="https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/section/arts-n-culture/">View all posts in Arts &amp; Culture</a></div>
		<div class="story-info">

			<div class="date">
			<span class="byline">By Jill Radsken, Harvard Staff Writer <span class="divider">|</span> </span>May 2, 2017
			</div>

		</div><!--/.story-info-->
		<div class="arrow"><a href="https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2017/05/a-celebration-of-harvard-artists-showcased-the-campus-arts/" data-category="next" data-action="arrow">&gt;</a></div>
	</div><!--/.story-block-->

                  <p>Lorgia García Peña and David Cox, both assistant professors with the Faculty of Arts and Sciences, have each won a 2017 Roslyn Abramson Award for excellence in undergraduate teaching.</p>
              </div>

			<h3><a href="https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2017/10/harvard-historian-sunil-amrith-wins-macarthur-genius-grant/" data-category="story_popular" data-action="title">‘Genius’-level honor for Harvard historian</a></h3>
			<div class="date">
			<span class="byline">By Jill Radsken, Harvard Staff Writer <span class="divider">|</span> </span>October 11, 2017 | 
		        <span class="label editorpick">Editor's Pick</span>
		        <span class="label popular">Popular</span>
			</div>
			<p class="abstract">Sunil Amrith, the Mehra Family Professor of South Asian Studies, has been awarded a MacArthur “Genius” Grant. </p>

		</div><!--/.story-info-->
		
	</div><!--/.story-block-->
		
	<div class="story-block clearfix ">
		<div class="story-photo">
			<a href="https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2017/04/over-nearly-80-years-harvard-study-has-been-showing-how-to-live-a-healthy-and-happy-life/" data-category="story_popular" data-action="img"><img src="https://harvardgazette.files.wordpress.com/2017/04/2017_3_4_agingseries_140px_healthy_aging.jpg" alt="Good genes are nice, but joy is better" /></a>
		</div><!--/.story-photo-->

		<div class="cat-icon science"><a href="https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/section/science-n-health/">View all posts in Science &amp; Health</a></div>
		<div class="story-info">
			<h3><a href="https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2017/04/over-nearly-80-years-harvard-study-has-been-showing-how-to-live-a-healthy-and-happy-life/" data-category="story_popular" data-action="title">Good genes are nice, but joy is better</a></h3>
			<div class="date">
			<span class="byline">By Liz Mineo, Harvard Staff Writer <span class="divider">|</span> </span>April 11, 2017 | 
		        <span class="label editorpick">Editor's Pick</span>
		        <span class="label popular">Popular</span>
			</div>
			<p class="abstract">For nearly 80 years, the Harvard Study of Adult Development has been producing data and lessons on how to live longer, happier, and healthier lives.</p>

		</div><!--/.story-info-->
		
	</div><!--/.story-block-->
		
	<div class="story-block clearfix ">
		<div class="story-photo">
			<a href="https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2017/09/harvard-researchers-help-develop-smart-tattoos/" data-category="story_popular" data-action="img"><img src="https://harvardgazette.files.wordpress.com/2017/09/tattoo140_140.jpg" alt="Feeling woozy? Time to check the tattoo" /></a>
		</div><!--/.story-photo-->

		<div class="cat-icon science"><a href="https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/section/science-n-health/">View all posts in Science &amp; Health</a></div>
		<div class="story-info">
			<h3><a href="https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2017/09/harvard-researchers-help-develop-smart-tattoos/" data-category="story_popular" data-action="title">Feeling woozy? Time to check the tattoo</a></h3>
			<div class="date">
			<span class="byline">By Alvin Powell, Harvard Staff Writer <span class="divider">|</span> </span>September 28, 2017 | 
		        <span class="label editorpick">Editor's Pick</span>
		        <span class="label video">Audio/Video</span>
		        <span class="label popular">Popular</span>
			</div>
			<p class="abstract">Harvard and MIT researchers have developed smart tattoo ink capable of monitoring health by changing color to tell an athlete if she is dehydrated or a diabetic if his blood sugar rises.
</p>

  <script>

    jQuery(window).scroll(function () {

      if (getInternetExplorerVersion() != 8) {
        var $totalHeight = jQuery('.sticky').outerHeight() + jQuery('#logo').outerHeight() + jQuery('.top-wrapper').outerHeight() + jQuery('.feature-photo-side .article-feature').outerHeight() + jQuery('.full-width-layout .article-head.feature-top').outerHeight() + jQuery('.full-width-layout .article-feature').outerHeight() + 10;

        var scroll_top = jQuery(window).scrollTop();

        if (scroll_top <= $totalHeight) {
          jQuery('#sticky-filter').hide();
        }
        if (scroll_top > $totalHeight) {
          jQuery('#sticky-filter').show();
        }
      }
    });

  </script>
<script>
  var prev_width = jQuery(window).width();
  var prev_height = jQuery(window).height();

  var inner_size = viewport();
  var prev_inner_width = inner_size['width'];

  window.onresize = function (event) {
    var w_width = jQuery(window).width();

    if (( w_width > 1242 && prev_width <= 1242 ) || ( w_width <= 1242 && prev_width > 1242 )) {
      if (( w_width > 1242 && prev_width <= 1242 )) {
        jQuery('#nav-open-btn').hide();
        jQuery('#nav-close-btn').hide();
        jQuery('#nav-open-btn').removeAttr('style');
        jQuery('#nav-close-btn').removeAttr('style');
      }
      prev_width = w_width;
    }

    var w_height = jQuery(window).height();
    if (w_height != prev_height) {
      if (use_tinyscroller()) {
        jQuery('#scrollbar1').tinyscrollbar({invertscroll: true});
      }
      else {
        set_scroller_height();
      }
    }

    //For photo description
    inner_size = viewport();
    var inner_width = inner_size['width'];
    if (inner_width > 475 && prev_inner_width <= 475) {
      jQuery('.article-feature-caption.tablet .toggle-more-less').hide();
      jQuery('.photo-description').removeAttr('style');
      prev_inner_width = inner_width;
    }
    else if (inner_width <= 475 && prev_inner_width > 475) {
      jQuery('.article-feature-caption.tablet .toggle-more-less').show();
      jQuery('.photo-description').removeAttr('style');
      prev_inner_width = inner_width;
    }
  }

</script>

<!-- new chartbeat code, put in March 2, 2013 -->
<script type="text/javascript">
  var _sf_async_config = {};
  /** CONFIGURATION START **/
  _sf_async_config.uid = 2327;
  _sf_async_config.domain = "news.harvard.edu";
  _sf_async_config.sections = "Campus &amp; Community, Awards";
        
  /** CONFIGURATION END **/
  (function () {
    function loadChartbeat() {
      window._sf_endpt = (new Date()).getTime();
      var e = document.createElement("script");
      e.setAttribute("language", "javascript");
      e.setAttribute("type", "text/javascript");
      e.setAttribute("src",
        (("https:" == document.location.protocol) ?
          "https://a248.e.akamai.net/chartbeat.download.akamai.com/102508/" :
          "http://static.chartbeat.com/") +
          "js/chartbeat.js");
      document.body.appendChild(e);
    }

    var oldonload = window.onload;
    window.onload = (typeof window.onload != "function") ?
      loadChartbeat : function () {
      oldonload();
      loadChartbeat();
    };
  })();
</script>

<!-- end chartbeat code -->

      <!--header regions end-->

				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>

										The URL might be incorrect or have changed.  Please go back to the <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >homepage</a>									</div>

				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-solr-search-box" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_search_solr_search_box no-title"  module="boxes" delta="solr_search_box"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-solr_search_box' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><form class="search-block-form" action="/pauladler/classes" method="post" id="search-block-form" accept-charset="UTF-8"><div><div class="container-inline">
  <div class="form-item form-type-textfield form-item-search-block-form">

</div></div></form></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>

		<footer id="footer" class="clearfix" role="contentinfo">

					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1423258810" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1423258810"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/academia-and-education" >Academia &amp; Education</a></li></ul></li><li class="menu-42489 menuparent  menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-headlines   odd   last "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/headlines" >Headlines</a><span class="open-submenu"></span><ul><li class="menu-42491 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-faculty-publications  first   odd  "><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/faculty-publications"  title="">Faculty News</a></li><li class="menu-42493 menu-path-histlitfasharvardedu-student-work   even  "><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/lecturer-application"  title="">Lecturer Positions</a></li></ul></li></ul>

  </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<div id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																								
																	<div id="content">
										The URL might be incorrect or have changed.  Please go back to the <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >homepage</a>									</div>
								
							</div><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

  </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<div id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																								
																	<div id="content">
										The URL might be incorrect or have changed.  Please go back to the <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >homepage</a>									</div>
								
							</div><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<div id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																								
																	<div id="content">
										The URL might be incorrect or have changed.  Please go back to the <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >homepage</a>									</div>
								
							</div><!--main content ends-->

					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1423258810" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1423258810"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

				  <!--main menu region beg-->
		  <div id="menu-bar" class="nav region-menu-bar clearfix"><nav id="block-os-primary-menu" class="block block-os no-title menu-wrapper menu-bar-wrapper clearfix"  module="os" delta="primary-menu">  
  
  <ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-primary-menu" id="nice-menu-primary-menu"><li class="menu-18550 menu-path-front  first   odd  "><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" class="menu-18620 menu-path-node-363416  first   odd  "><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/since-1906"  title="">Since 1906</a></li><li class="menu-21034 menu-path-node-426411   even  "><a       <div class="node-content">
        <div class="pic-bio clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-professional-title field-type-text field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Class of 2017, American Studies<br />Business Strategy and Data Analytics Analyst, LinkedIn</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="OutlineElement Ltr SCXW200981896" style="direction:ltr">
	<p class="Paragraph SCXW200981896" style="font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; vertical-align:baseline; background-color:transparent; color:windowtext; text-align:left; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; padding-left:0px; padding-right:0px; text-indent:0px">
