<article id="node-839026" class="node node-person node-teaser article with-person-photo modified-in-os_profiles_process_node clearfix" role="article" target="_top">

      
    
    <div class="field field-name-field-person-photo field-type-imagefield-crop field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser">
    <div class="field-items">
            <div class="field-item even">
      <figure>
        <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/people/mattie-kahn"  target="_top"><img class="image-style-profile-thumbnail" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/profile_thumbnail/public/histlit/files/screen_shot_2016-08-16_at_9.32.34_am.png?m=1502205910&amp;itok=vku4bl-h" width="75" height="75" alt="Mattie Kahn" title="Mattie Kahn" /></a>              </figure>
      </div>
        </div>
</div>    
    <div class="person-teaser-wrapper">  
              <header class="node-header">
                      <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">

				  <div class="region region-sidebar-first sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-113271"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/alumni"  class="active-trail active">Alumni Profiles</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-161171"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/recent-graduates"  class="active-trail active active">Recent Graduates</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-161176"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/arts-and-entertainment" >Arts &amp; Entertainment</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-161181"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/media-and-journalism" >Media &amp; Journalism</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-161191"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/government-and-non-profit" >Government &amp; Non-Profit</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-161196"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/medicine" >Medicine</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-161186"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/law" >Law</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-161201"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/business-and-finance" >Business &amp; Finance</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-161206"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/academia-and-education" >Academia &amp; Education</a></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>				  <!--sidebar first region end-->
        
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1469544082" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_follow"  module="boxes" delta="1469544082"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Connect with Hist &amp; Lit alumni!</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1469544082' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div class="item-list"><ul class="follow-me-links-vertical"><li><a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/272244719778081/"  class="follow-icon" style="background-position: -531px 0px" target="_blank">https://www.facebook.com/groups/272244719778081/</a><span class='service-name-span'><a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/272244719778081/"  class="follow-icon-service-name" target="_blank">Facebook</a></span></li><li><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/groups/8523857/profile"  class="follow-icon" style="background-position: -340px 0px" target="_blank">https://www.linkedin.com/groups/8523857/profile</a><span class='service-name-span'><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/groups/8523857/profile"  class="follow-icon-service-name" target="_blank">LinkedIn</a></span></li></ul></div></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1437536011" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1437536011"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Where are they now?</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1437536011' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>Here's a sample of the positions History &amp; Literature alumni have accepted in the past few years.</p>
<ul><li><span>Arthur A. Levine Books, Editorial Assistant</span></li>
<li><span>Bain &amp; Company, Associate Consultant</span></li>
<li><span>Barclays, Global Markets Analyst</span></li>
<li><span>Cambridge University Press, Senior Editorial Assistant</span></li>
<li><span>Clinton Health Access Initiative, Global Markets Associate</span></li>
<li><span>Davis Polk &amp; Wardwell, Associate</span></li>
<li><span>Ford Foundation, Consultant</span></li>
<li><span>Google, User Insights Analyst</span></li>
<li><span>Holliday Fenoglio Fowler LP, Real Estate Analyst</span></li>
<li><span>IBM Design Studio, Analytics Program Manager</span></li>
<li><span>Michigan Children's Law Center, Equal Justice Works Fellow</span></li>
<li><span>Michigan Opera Theatre, Stage Director</span></li>
<li><span>The New Yorker, Integrated Marketing Manager</span></li>
<li><span>OpenTable, Inc., Marketing Editor</span></li>
<li><span>Paul Weiss Rifkind Wharton &amp; Garrison LLP, Associate</span></li>
<li><span>Pulse Films, Director of Digital Partnerships</span></li>
<li><span>Simon &amp; Schuster, Associate Editor</span></li>
<li><span>St Bernard Parish Public Schools, Biology Teacher</span></li>
<li><span>Time Inc., Corporate Strategy Analyst</span></li>
<li><span>US Department of State, Foreign Service Officer</span></li>
</ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>
		<!--footer region beg-->
		<footer id="footer" class="clearfix" role="contentinfo">

					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1423258810" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1423258810"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1423258810' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/"><img height="66" width="475" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-large" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_large/public/histlit/files/hlbanner1.png?m=1435681341&amp;itok=YHiT_esd" alt="" title="" /></a></p></div></div></div>

  </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<div id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																								
																	<div id="content">
										The URL might be incorrect or have changed.  Please go back to the <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >homepage</a>									</div>
								
							</div><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1423258810" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1423258810"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>

								<a name="main-content"></a>
																								
																	<div id="content">
										The URL might be incorrect or have changed.  Please go back to the <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >homepage</a>									</div>

					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1423258810" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1423258810"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1423258810' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/"><img height="66" width="475" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-large" src="//static.projects.iq.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_large/public/histlit/files/hlbanner1.png?m=1435681341&amp;itok=YHiT_esd" alt="" title="" /></a></p></div></div></div>

				  <!--main menu region beg-->
		  <div id="menu-bar" class="nav region-menu-bar clearfix"><nav id="block-os-primary-menu" class="block block-os no-title menu-wrapper menu-bar-wrapper clearfix"  module="os" delta="primary-menu">  
  
  <ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-primary-menu" id="nice-menu-primary-menu"><li class="menu-18550 menu-path-front  first   odd  "><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >Home</a></li><li class="menu-18642 menuparent  menu-path-node-363656   even  "><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/learn-more"  title="">Learn More</a><span class="open-submenu"></span><ul><li class="menu-18620 menu-path-node-363416  first   odd  "><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/since-1906"  title="">Since 1906</a></li><li class="menu-21034 menu-path-node-426411   even  "><a 		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">

				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>

								<a name="main-content"></a>
																								
																	<div id="content">
										The URL might be incorrect or have changed.  Please go back to the <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >homepage</a>									</div>

<div id="page" class="container page header-main content-none footer">

					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/the-concentration" >THE CONCENTRATION</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Courses That Count                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-363146" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	The following courses count for concentration credit in the fields of History &amp; Literature. In most cases, this means that at least 50% of the material in the course relates directly to a distribution requirement or field.
</p>

<h3>
	<a name="field" id="field"></a>
</h3>

<ul class="anchor-list"><li>
		<a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/CTC-ethnic-studies" style="text-decoration:none" title="">Ethnic Studies</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/CTC-america" style="text-decoration:none" title="">American Studies</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/CTC-latin-america" style="text-decoration:none">Latin American Studies</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/CTC-europe" style="text-decoration:none">European Studies</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/CTC-medieval-world" style="text-decoration:none">Medieval World</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/CTC-early-modern" style="text-decoration:none">Early Modern World</a>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/modern-world" style="text-decoration:none">Modern World</a>
	</li>
</ul><p>
	If you find a course that you think is well-suited to your own particular course of study, but that does not appear on the list, you may submit a Petition. If you have any questions about courses or concentration credits, please speak with one of the <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/people/people/administrative-team" style="text-decoration:none">Assistant Directors of Studies</a>.
</p>

<p>
	All History &amp; Literature concentrators, regardless of field, may count one Arts &amp; Humanities course (including Humanities Pathways, Frameworks, Colloquia: Essential Texts, Essential Questions, and Studio) OR one <a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/hl90s" style="text-decoration:none">HL90 Seminar</a> not in the student’s field for concentration credit as an elective.
</p>

<ul><li>
		The <a href="http://artsandhumanities.fas.harvard.edu/book/humanities-10a-and-10b-humanities-colloquium-essential-works-1-2" style="text-decoration:none" target="_blank">Humanities Colloquium </a>courses include:

		<ul><li>
				Humanities 10a. <em>Essential Works in the Western Tradition 1</em>.
			</li>
			<li>
				Humanities 10b. <em>Essential Works in the Western Tradition 2</em>.
			</li>
		</ul></li>
	<li>
		The <a href="http://artsandhumanities.fas.harvard.edu/pages/pathways" style="text-decoration:none" target="_blank">Frameworks in the Humanities</a> courses include:
		<ul><li>
				Humanities 11a. <em>The Art of Looking</em>.
			</li>
			<li>
				Humanities 11b. <em>The Art of Listening</em>.
			</li>
			<li>
				Humanities 11c. <em>The Art of Reading</em>.
			</li>
		</ul></li>
	<li>
		The <a href="http://artsandhumanities.fas.harvard.edu/pages/pathways" style="text-decoration:none" target="_blank">Pathways in the Humanities</a> courses include:
		<ul><li>
				Humanities 12. <em>Essential Works in World Literature</em>.
			</li>
			<li>
				Humanities 52. <em>Human History</em>.
			</li>
			<li>
				Humanities 53. <em>Revolution, Reform and Conservatism in Western Culture</em>.
			</li>
			<li>
				Humanities 54. <em>The Urban Imagination</em>.
			</li>
		</ul></li>
</ul></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

      <h2 class="block-title">Previous Courses that Count</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1442274414' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div>
	<a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/ethnic_studies_ctc_2016-2017.docx" style="text-decoration:none">2016-2017 (Ethnic Studies)</a>
</div>

<div>
	<a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/amstud_ctc_2016-2017_new.docx" style="text-decoration:none">2016-2017 (American Studies - new worksheet)</a><br /><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/2016-2017_american_studies_ctc.pdf" style="text-decoration:none">2016-2017 (American Studies - old worksheet)</a>
</div>

<div>
	<a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/latin_american_studies_ctc_-_website.docx" style="text-decoration:none">2016-2017 (Latin American Studies)</a>
</div>

<div>
	<a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/european_studies_ctc_-_website.docx" style="text-decoration:none">2016-2017 (European Studies)</a>
</div>

<div>
	<a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/medieval_world_ctc_-_website.docx" style="text-decoration:none">2016-2017 (Medieval World)</a>
</div>

<div>
	<a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/early_modern_world_ctc_-_website.docx" style="text-decoration:none">2016-2017 (Early Modern World)</a>
</div>

<div>
	<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/european_studies_2015-2016.docx" style="text-decoration:none">2015-2016 (European Studies)</a>
</div>

	<a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/ctc_america_2015-16-new.pdf" style="text-decoration:none">2015-2016 (America field)</a>
</div>

	<a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/courses_that_count_non-america_15-16_master_list_spring.docx" style="text-decoration:none"><span style="text-decoration:none">2015-2016 (Non-America fields)</span></a><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/ctc_america_2015-16.docx" style="text-decoration:none"> </a><br /><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/august_courses_that_count_non-america_fields_2013-2014_ii.docx" style="text-decoration:none">2015-2016 (Postcolonial)</a><br /><a href="https://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/ctc_america_2014-15_-_new.pdf" style="text-decoration:none">2014-2015 (America field)</a><br /><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/2014-15_non-america_class_of_2017.docx" style="text-decoration:none">2014-2015 (Non-America fields)</a><br /><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/2013-2014_america_field_electives_and_requirements.docx" style="text-decoration:none">2013-2014 (America field)</a><br /><a href="http://histlit.fas.harvard.edu/files/histlit/files/2013-14_non-america_fields.docx" style="text-decoration:none">2013-2014 (Non-America fields)</a>
